• COMMISSION YOUR OWN FULL COLOUR COMIC PAGE!  I’ll create an exclusive A4 comic page just for you. It can be about whatever you want, and, if you like, feature any of my characters. Want me to draw an exclusive Chaffy comic for you? Want me to draw you IN a comic with Looshkin? Want me to draw your kids running around with Bunny Vs Monkey? Want me to just draw a comic about a sad banana? Hey, you’re the boss!
I’ll discuss with you what you want me to do, if you have any ideas for a script, and any requests for what should appear. Then I’ll go away and write a rough script for your approval. Once approved, I’ll turn this script into a finished, colour, single-page comic (approx 9 – 12 panels).
Once complete, I’ll send you a digital version of the finished artwork, as well as an A4 colour print, and the original black and white inkwork! 
My only restrictions are that the comic must be within the bounds of taste and decency, and if it features one of my original characters or a copyrighted character then it can’t be reprinted in a publication – this is only for personal use.
I very rarely do commissions, so this is a great chance to get an exclusive, unique comic! To see more examples of my comic work, check out my site at www.fumboo.com
•  Also includes 3 Chaffies (I’ll most likely hide one in your comic too), and everything else from the TREATS tier.
(Want to see a sample of the picture search? Click HERE!)
• COMMISSION YOUR OWN FIND CHAFFY PICTURE SEARCH! I'll create an exclusive Find Chaffy picture search puzzle for you. You and I can discuss what animal/creature you want to be the theme, and also any other things you might want to hide in there - perhaps yourself, your children, your pets. Anything you like (within the bounds of taste and decency)! 
• Once complete, I'll send you a digital version of the finished full colour artwork, as well as an A3 colour print, and the A2 original black and white lineart.
• Also includes ten Chaffies (real life versions of the Chaffies hidden in your picture!) and everything else from Tier 4.
This is a very rare chance to commission such a unique and personal piece of art!
Whichever tier you choose, as long as your tier includes a physical item (such as the Chaffy figure, the paperback book, or the print set), then you can always order ADDITIONAL copies of those things. Want a load of Chaffies to hand out to your friends? Want extra books to pass onto your school? Well just add the following amounts to your total, and when our Kickstarter campaign is over we'll send out a survey asking you to confirm which extras you've ordered.
(By the way, if you've already pledged and later decide you want to add extras, you can do this at any time during the campaign by clicking 'manage your pledge' and adding the extra amount!)
Not only does every extra Chaffy you order come with its own sketch card, mini booklet, certificate and set of four art cards, we'll also include an exclusive set of FIND CHAFFY FRIENDSHIP STICKERS!
(Any tiers involving multiple Chaffy vinyl figures will also receive these stickers)
Reaching the target would be utterly incredible, and really enable Find Chaffy to become something special. However, just in case the campaign goes even better than expected, we've prepared a few stretch goals. Once unlocked, these bonus items will ship to everyone who funds at certain tiers (to be announced).
While it can be tricky with a Kickstarter campaign to work out the exact costings, we've done our best to estimate what we'll need to make this work. In fact we've slightly over-estimated, so there's enough of a buffer to cover any problems.
The £8,500 target breaks down like this:
(Please note: All amounts are estimates, and pie chart isn't to exact scale)
We'll be working with Madebycooper to produce the Chaffy vinyl figures, Comic Printing UK for the Find Chaffy books, and Awesome Merchandise for the extras - all of whom come very highly recommended in their respective industries!
I have run two crowdfunding campaigns before: The first was to self-publish a comic book, the second to raise money and send comics to Readathon. Both beat their targets, and were successfully fulfilled.
For this campaign, we're hoping to have everything ready and shipped out by the end of November this year, just in time for Christmas. Unforeseen circumstances may of course arise, but we've checked and triple-checked our schedule, our accounting, everything we can. In short: I want Find Chaffy to be appreciated by as many people as possible, so I'll be working hard to try and make sure everything happens as planned.
Hello! My name is Jamie Smart, and I've been working full-time as an illustrator for nearly 20 years. For most of that time I have been lucky enough to write and draw my own comics, including titles such as Bear, Bunny Vs Monkey, Space Raoul, Whubble and Fish-Head Steve. I created and edited the children's anthology Moose Kid Comics, released a number of childrens books, created a number of long-running webcomics, and worked extensively in TV development.
Not only that, but I've been allowed to work on other people's well-known properties too, including illustrating my own Doctor Who book (eek!), and writing and drawing such classic characters as Desperate Dan and Roger The Dodger for The Dandy and The Beano.
My full client list includes: The Phoenix, The Beano, The Dandy, Toxic, Scholastic, OUP, DFB, Random House, Cartoon Network and Disney. To see examples of my work, please check out my website.
I live just outside London, in the UK. If you have any questions for me about this project, or about anything, you can usually find me babbling on twitter -> @jamiesmart
I love creating characters and comics, and Find Chaffy has been a passion project for most of my career. Any help you can give either supporting or sharing this Kickstarter would be hugely appreciated.

updates.update_content:
Hi everyone!
Just a quick one. I try not to send out updates when there isn’t any specific news, but a few people have been asking about the remaining Chaffies so my apologies if I’ve not been keeping you updated enough.
Some backers are still waiting for their Chaffies and for that I’m sorry (and frustrated too that you’re waiting). I’ve detailed what’s been going on with our manufacturers in previous updates, but because we started from scratch with a new manufacturer, it has taken this long to get everything approved again. Please know I’m pushing as much as possible, and as soon as the new batch of Chaffies arrive I’ll send out another update, and become an absolute blur of packing and posting to get them out to you.

... we're getting closer!
Hello! Jamie here. As detailed in my previous update (January 20th), we had a bit of trouble with the manufacturer of our Chaffy vinyl figures, and as such could only send out (approx) 60% of our orders. I assigned a new manufacturer to the case, but it did mean starting from scratch (3D models, prototypes, etc etc) which pushed all my best laid plans into delay.
I now have a clearer schedule from the new manufacturer and so I wanted to update you with where we're at. This week my contact is going out to Hong Kong - where the figures are being made - to oversee the first prototype personally, and then sending it to me for approval (I imagine he was going out there anyway, but the point is, it's fantastic to have someone actually in the factory on my behalf). Once the prototype is approved, production will take about a month. So this means that all being well we should be receiving all the new Chaffies by end of April/early May. Then we'll get straight to work packaging up all the remaining orders, which'll take another week or two.

campaign.story:
An Animation Icon
Used by animation professionals and students for decades, the animation disc is an integral part of the traditional animation process. It’s become an icon for 2D animation and while there have been many iterations over the years, I chose to create a pin based on the disc most commonly used by large animation studios in the US.
The Pin
Final pin design and color callouts
The 1” hard enamel pin comes with a 2.5” x 1.75” backer card. The design is already completed and I am simply looking for the funds to order the first production run of pins.
Kickstarter backers will save $2 if they order their pin now, as they will each cost $10 after the Kickstarter has completed.
If funded, I will place the order right away and should be shipping your pins out in a matter of weeks.
Final pin design with backer card
Thanks so much for looking and please feel free to contact me with any questions or comments!

The Futurist Co. Secret Society Membership will give you unlimited access to the mysterious new toy company located in Chicago, IL. We intend to rediscover the way toys used to be made with a futuristic twist. Technology has taken over the toy industry and most new toys that are introduced these days are all digital. It's time to get back to beautifully crafted, eye pleasing, physical toys where people of all ages can play with, cherish, collect, and hand down to their children. 
As a member, you will receive:
Official Futurist Co. Secret Decoder
Official Membership Card  
Official Futurist Co. Lapel Pin
Official Golden Certificate
The Futurist Co. Secret Decoder is the official decoder used to unscramble all of Wilbur Wonder's secret words of wisdom to all members. Wilbur is a time traveler who wants to share his knowledge with you. You can find all of his stories on www.thefuturistco.com under Wilbur's blog. He will also have live podcasts which will broadcast on the site as well. It is extremely dangerous for Wilbur to speak of his travels and so he uses encrypted messages for safety.
The Futurist Co. Secret Decoder Copper Front. The front side of the decoder is where you decode all of Wilbur's messages. Wilbur will give all members a number to set their decoders to in order to reveal his secrets. You turn the inner dial to the set number and start deciphering his message letter by letter until it comes together! Once decoded, you can ponder Wilbur's mysterious words and interpret them on your own. These secret messages will be at the end of each blog post. 
The Official Membership Card is signed and approved by Wilbur Wonder to signify that you are a part of the elite Futurist Co. Society. Attached to the membership card is the The Futurist Co. Lapel Pin. Wear your pin proud on a jacket, backpack, or bag and it will catch someone's eye.
The Official Golden Certificate. This certificate can be hung or displayed to show that you are a true Futurist! If you want to keep your membership a secret, then storing it away as a keepsake in a nice hiding spot will do as well. 
 Introducing 2 fantastic rewards straight from Wilbur Wonder himself! 
The Futurist Co. Official Time Capsule is a beautifully designed pure copper pod to store all of your treasures into for future discovery. The time capsule comes equipped with a day, month and year setting in order for the next generations to unearth and enjoy. Place this capsule into the ground of a secret spot, a family home, a garden, the mountains, the desert, the forest, anywhere! This capsule was meant to create a special moment between families and friends in which they can cherish and think about for the rest of their lives. 
*If you would like more than one time capsule then please add $175 for each capsule to your pledge and notate it in your survey at the end of the campaign!
The Futurist Co. introduces The Wilbur Wonder Almanac 2018-2023! Take a peak into the future with the Almanac that many would love to get their hands on! This Almanac will only be issued to members of The Futurist Co. Secret Society! DO NOT SHOW OR GIVE THIS TO ANYONE WHO IS NOT A MEMBER OF THE FUTURIST CO. That is all I can say about this book. Aren't you curious? 
Who Is Wilbur Wonder?
The mystery which surrounds The Futurist Co. is stirred up by Wilbur Wonder. He is a time traveler who visits the future from time to time (yes they are out there). You think I'm joking, don't you? I assure you this isn't some kind of stunt, and to prove it, he will speak of his travels. This type of behavior, however, is quite dangerous. You see, a fundamental rule of a futurist is to keep the memories of your travels to yourself. If the future is altered due to pre-obtained knowledge, then there will be a price to pay. As a member of The Futurist Co. you will be able to learn all of Wilbur's secrets of the future through his blog and podcast which will broadcast on www.thefuturistco.com. It is your responsibility to stay loyal to Wilbur and to all the rest of the futurists out there and keep the secrets within the society. They will be watching!
"Curiosity of the future lies deep within all of us. What a wonderful gift it would be to discover it before anyone else. I welcome you into my world to do just that."
The Official Futurist Co. Lapel Pin and Membership Card
The Only One Of Its Kind! The "Silver" Futurist Co. Secret Decoder used by Wilbur Wonder himself!
The Futurist Co. Secret Society Decoder uses an old Roman encryption method. All members will receive a copper decoder. 
Go to www.thefuturistco.com to follow Wilbur Wonder!
You have reached the end of this campaign, you think it's a cute idea and decide to leave without joining The Futurist Co. Secret Society, but wait... 
Read below:
Time Travel Is Possible But Only To The Future
We may be able to book our ticket to the future someday — it’ll just be a one-way trip.  
In a presentation at the British Science Festival, particle physicist Brian Cox said that time travel is possible but only in one direction.  
“The central question is, can you build a time machine? The answer is yes, you can go into the future,” the University of Manchester professor told the audience during his hour-long speech on Tuesday, according to The Telegraph. “You’ve got almost total freedom of movement in the future.”  
Cox detailed how time travel to the future is possible under Albert Einstein’s general theory of relativity. Traveling hundreds, or even thousands of years into the future, could be accomplished if someone was traveling at an incredibly fast pace, close to the speed of light.  
Discovery News equated the theory to the so-called “Twin Paradox:
” Imagine twins, one stays on Earth (Twin A) while the other (Twin B) boards a spaceship and flies off at relativistic speeds. Compared with Twin A’s timeframe, Twin B’s timeframe will slow. If time is running slower for Twin B, then he/she will return to Earth where a lot more time has passed and Twin A has aged significantly more than Twin B. The mechanism behind this is “time dilation” and it has a stronger effect as you travel closer and closer to the speed of light. "
Coming back from the future or traveling to another point in the past is much less likely, according to Cox.  
Relating his theory to the popular British science fiction show “Doctor Who,” Cox explained that the time-traveling Doctor would need to find a wormhole in order to return to the past. The theoretical bridge, or shortcut through space-time, proposed under Einstein’s general-relativity theory has never been proven to exist. And, even if a wormhole were discovered or created, there’s no telling whether humans could actually use it to travel through time.  
Cox isn’t the only one to theorize that a wormhole could allow time-travelers to travel backward in time. Earlier this year, astrophysicist Eric W. Davis of the EarthTech International Institute for Advanced Studies said that a wormhole would be the best option for back-in-time travel. But, Davis acknowledged, it would “take a Herculean effort to turn a wormhole into a time machine.”
-Sara Gates, The Huffington Post

campaign.story:
I was thinking recently about those days when I'm not in the mood for small talk or big crowds, when I'm just happy to be by myself. I think just about everybody has a day like that from time to time, and can relate?
So... I thought it would be interesting to design a set of enamel pins and stickers that reflects these feelings. Something that celebrates the introvert in all of us! 
Large stickers: 
Custom shaped gloss vinyl stickers. The Selectively Social sticker will be approximately 7cm high and the Can't People Today sticker will be approximately 8cm wide.
Enamel pins:
- hard enamel
- dark metal structure 
- rubber clutch
- exclusively designed backing cards
- Selectively Social pin: 35mm high
- Can't People Today pin: 45mm wide
My name is Barbara and I am the owner and designer behind Box Monster. After working as an architect for a number of years in London and Italy, in 2016 I decided to pursue my passion for drawing and crafting. The result is Box Monster, a brand that produces unique and colourful accessories and jewellery, all designed by me!
You can find all our products in the online shop:
box-monster.com
And follow us on social medias for all the latest news, giveaways etc.:

6 iconic soda brands, reproduced in 8 Colours, hand printed in London - Limited Edition signed screenprints.

PLUS an A2 giclee poster featuring 40 of my favourite designs.

  40 original and historic bottle cap designs

 Bringing Graphic Design into people's homes
I'm Tom Love, a graphic designer and artist. This is my 6th Kickstarter Project, taking design ephemera and re-imagining them as blown-up fine art. My work has been shown across the UK as well as Berlin and Moscow.
The ProjectLike my previous five successful projects, Go Pop recognises the striking graphic narrative of the 20th Century and explores the often-overlooked relationship between art and graphic design. The Go Pop! series will bring to life my collection of vintage bottle caps, blown up in size and hand printed to produce a series of high-quality fine art.

The collection consists of 6 iconic soda brands; Coca-Cola, Pepsi, 7up, Cherry Coke, NEHI and Mello Yello. I’m also sharing 40 of my favourite designs on a Kickstarter exclusive A2 giclee printed poster.
__
500mm x 500mm Fine Art Screenprints
  Styled by The Pink House
The concept
Being able to see the beauty in everyday functional design isn't easy when we're busy going about our busy lives. That's why I want to change the context in which graphic design is viewed – by blowing them up into much bigger versions of themselves so that every tiny detail can be admired. From the use of typography to colour and form, design becomes art and begins to create an emotional reaction.
__
The Collection of 500mm x 500mm Fine Art Screenprints
Design inspired pop art printsI want more people to value the role design has in our lives and I want more people to have access to affordable, quality art that can inspire and delight them. Refreshing homes into designer pads. To do this each detail of the original bottle cap is meticulously and painstakingly reproduced for print. 
The result: a blown up bottle cap that captures the mood of an era and the beauty of graphic design. The bottle caps will be screenprinted at 500mm x 500mm, using 8 colours (including metallic inks) to form an exclusive limited edition. Each one printed on the highest quality archival paper, hand signed by the artist (Tom love) alongside the edition number, making sure each one is a collectable and covetable piece of affordable fine art.

About me
I'm Tom Love, a graphic designer/artist born in Leicester, schooled at the renowned Falmouth College of Arts and now calling London my home.
From a very young age, I've always had a passion for design and somehow always knew I wanted to be a designer when I grew up.
This singular goal of being a designer was set in motion the day my grandad passed his stamp collection on to me. Stamps opened up a new world to me, with these tiny little pieces of paper telling stories from a world I hadn't yet explored. Through bright, colourful illustrations, photographs and typography in languages I'd never seen before, these stamps ignited my passion and love for graphic design, travel and popular culture.
From the humble beginnings of a single stamp book, I've now amassed an eclectic collection of 20th century design from cigarettes packets, stamps and matchbox labels to luggage tags and bottle caps. The beauty and balance of design at such a small, functional scale fascinates me and has led me to my art projects today.
Join me on a screenprinting adventure as I bring these fantastic examples of 20th century branding to life and into homes across the world.

Since 2013 I have been designing and printing limited edition screenprints of my personal collection of 20th century branding and packaging design. Blowing them up in scale and producing exclusive editions which have been featured in various galleries across Europe.

My previous kickstarter projects have all been successfully funded.

These are high quality art prints, using only the best quality papers and inks.

I will keep all funders and supporters up-to-date with the production through regular updates - showing the complete printing process.

Posters will be mailed in sturdy Kraft Tubes and protective acid free tissue paper to protect the prints on their journey to you.

Each print will be certificated, hand signed and numbered. 
This Kickstarter will be the ONLY edition of these designs.

There are very few risks involved, but along the way plenty of challenges will throw themselves at me, as if often the case when producing something that is hand-made. I'm an experienced screenprinter and can happily guarantee the quality of each print.

updates.update_content:
Hi everyone,
I’m super happy, excited and above all else RELIEVED to tell you that the Screenprints are finished, signed, numbered and have started to ship!!!
I’ve spent every spare evening and weekend since August making sure these are the best prints I have created to date. I’m so happy with them and I hope you will be too... once they’re in your hands and on your walls, I’m sure you will agree they were worth the wait.

It's been a long busy summer and I apologise for not keeping all you amazing backers up-to-date with the screenprinting progress.

I'm pleased to tell you the Pepsi 7 colour print is finished, and the Coca Cola print is awaiting it's last 2 layers of colour which has had to be postponed because of problems with the ink I was sent.
Unfortunately I am running a bit behind, mainly due to waiting on specialist inks to arrive and also booking time in the shared print studio has been tricky at best! It seems it's a busy summer for screenprinting!

I've got a bunch of printing slots booked in for September and I'm hoping all prints will be finished and ready to ship out near to the end of September, apologies for the delay and now the summer is drawing to an end, I will ensure I keep everyone regularly updated from now on.

Apologies for the radio silence the last couple of weeks.
Once the project finishes it's a bit of a waiting game for the funds to clear (takes about 2 weeks) so in that time I've been diligently planning out the costs, materials and all the boring spreadsheet bits - I won't bore you with the screenshots!
Screenprint Studio Time Booked

We did it!

We reached the goal and a whole load more!!!

Thank you everyone who supported the project in all the different ways and thank you to every single person who backed the project.
I'm going to take a couple of days off from Kickstarter to recover.
When I'm back, I will be sending out Backer Surveys so I can get a firm grip as to how many of each print has been ordered and I can start getting to work on sourcing all the various equipment needed.

Have a great weekend and you'll hear from me again next week.

There's only a few hours to go now but I'm getting quite a few people asking me how they can pledge for more than one print so I've put together a simple how to step guide below.
This assumes you've already backed for one of the rewards, if you haven't then choose one of the rewards levels you d like and follow the steps once you've made an initial pledge.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The reason we set an ambitious funding goal is to ensure that we have everything together once the campaign ends. So we can guarantee that if we reach our funding goal, the product will roll. If we don’t, you get your money back.

Some “experts” told us: “Don’t set a high funding goal, it won’t look good.” Not with us! We are very serious about this product and even more about the people who trust us. If you think this product is worth backing, do it. Share with your friends, let’s make it a success! 
Of course there are always force majeure risks (civil unrest, wildfires, bankruptcies, etc.), which are not to be neglected in the consumer product market. We try to limit this risk by concentrating our production in a safe and boring country like Germany.

Producing here costs more, but gives us more control and provides more security for our backers. The plant is just 3 hours by car from our office in Frankfurt, not 16 plane hours away, subcontracted to someone we’ve never seen!

Our partner, Walther Faltbox System (est. 1979, www.faltbox.com), a world market leader in designing and manufacturing high-end industrial boxes and logistic solutions, is still a family business. We looked for the most reliable partner, so our backers can rely on us. Should things not go as planned – be it a delay in the manufacturing timeline, late shipping or something else – we promise to communicate honestly and work around the clock until we fix the issue.

campaign.story:
I'm a graphic artist and illustrator that happens to have an affinity for Thrift Store and secondhand shopping.  I love the hunt and finding cool vintage or nostalgic things, and I know plenty of other people do too.  I also collect enamel pins, and wanted to combine those passions.  
My idea is to make a series of enamel pins called Thrift Score!  A celebration of treasures found and collected by so many.  In the first set of hopefully many, I've focused on 3 things that are a staple of any good secondhand treasure hunt, Records, Artwork, and Toys!  
The idea of which is that the pin itself is a conversation starter, say you're at a flea market and you're wearing a pin of the Ghostbusters firehouse, and a someone sees it.  Next thing you know they're asking about the pin, and saying, "You know, I collect and sell vintage toys too! Why don't I show you what I have for sale "  OR you're wearing a pin with the cover of your "holy grail" record that you can't seem to find anywhere, and someone sees it and says, " Great pin! I actually have that album!"  Strike up a conversation, maybe make a new collector friend, or maybe even use it to pick up that elusive item you didn't even know they had!

The 3 pins in the initial series are as follows:

A milkcrate full of records. 1.75 in. in size available in 4 different color crates (50 of each color for 200 pcs total )  Not only do you get this great looking pin, it comes with a free sticker sheet of 8 valuable / collectible albums for you to apply to it, so the world knows what kind of music you're into / looking for.  Plus if you back at the $20.00 level, I'll make you stickers of 5 custom album covers!
Here's the 4 different colors and the 8 stickers to place on the record sleeve

A thrift store painting with a surprise, in the style of Keane.  Also limited to 200 and 1.75" tall.  These paintings are a staple of second hand and antique shops, usually of large eyed children holding pets.  But this pin contains a secret!  A paper back that can be cut open / removed to reveal a secret inside!  Maybe you get an original copy of the Declaration of Independance, an early animation cel, an antique comic book, or a stack of cash! Every pin's contents is random.  To my knowledge this is a first of it's kind, and I'm very excited to get these made!   
Here's the dimensions for the painting, and how the hollow center will work.
The special items inside will be mostly paper items, printed and placed inside.  They will be random, but I'll include a sheet of possibilities so you know how rare the one you got is.  They include, a valuable animation cel, a copy of the Declaration of Independance, A valuable old comic book, and probably a few other surprises.  All items will be miniaturized to the scale of the painting and placed inside the hollow of the pin, covered by the brown paper on the back.  


And the last pin is of The Real Ghostbusters Firehouse Playset, a staple of my childhood and a must have for any vintage toy collector!  This pin is also 1.75" and limited to 200.
Firehouse pin, the x's are the areas that will be punched out of the pin.
The pins will be manufactured by PinGameStrong.com, I've already priced out the production cost, and the turn around time is roughly 4 weeks from when the order is placed. After that 4 weeks, when I recieve the pins, it would probably take me about a week to get all of the surprises made and placed inside the paintings, and have all the stickers printed and custom ones designed and printed. Then another week to get them shipped out to everyone who pledged. There's always the chance for production delays, but I doubt it would be for more than a week or 2 tops, if any. This is my first kickstarter project, although I have had one pin / sticker manufactured in the past, so I am a little aware of all the steps involved. 
Any pins left over after all the preorders would be sold on my etsy store for varying prices, to be determined, but this is the only time to get all 3 for $25!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Honestly the only real risk here is the time it takes to be manufactured, There could be a slight delay if something goes wrong, or there's any issues with the production. Also, The hollow in the painting pin may not be up to spec the first time, the pin company says it may be a first of it's kind, so that means anything could happen, and it may add to the production time. I would keep all the backers informed with pictures and information along the way.

updates.update_userinfo: Sorry backers. We need to cancel this project
updates.update_content:
According to the progress, up to 95% we will not get funded in 24 days (We have no extra money to buy agency’s service for campaign boost). We don’t want to waste our backer’s time waiting for something we know it won’t happen. 
We think admitting the fact and handle it with a positive attitude is better to give fake hope and pretending we will succeed at last.

We choose to learn from the mistakes and we will come back again very soon with better content, more suitable funding amount and much shorter duration (7-10 days).  
We give our sincere apologies to our backers, we are sorry for failing on this campaign, and deeply sorry for all the inconvenience caused. See you all again soon!

We have got 53% funded so far, thank you so much for all the backers!
Hopefully we can get fully funded soon :) 

Just a casual sharing of our work

Hi Everyone, I hope you are all doing great :) 
Today is day 2, we are getting 43% funded which is an unexpected good start to us! We wanted to take this opportunity to thank all of our backers! Thank you!! 

As you might have already noticed from our campaign description, the reason of launching this project is, because we want to let more people around the world to know more about this kind of handcraft technique, as well as our figure culture :)  And, during these two short days, I have received messages from people in different countries! For us, this is huge!! Because it means we are really on the way of reaching out to people outside Hong Kong and China (although we are not yet 100% funded, it feels like we have already did! :P) !!

History of the Elder Sign
The Elder Sign is a protective ward. Invoked as a hand gesture, it serves the same function as protection against the evil eye or crossing oneself —comforting, but ultimately without benefit. Carved into something solid—rock, glass, wood, or even precious metal—enchanted with magic, and worn openly, it provides a defense against the minions of the Great Old Ones.

Welcome to our Kickstarter for a set of soft enamel badges featuring some of the most infamous Cthulhu Mythos books ever read by scholars of elder lore! Show your knowledge of the Mythos by displaying these badges on your person, dice bag, game gear, or even a hat!
We are looking for your backing to fund this set of badges!
The Necronomicon displayed on a dice bag.
We have just one pledge level for this Kickstarter. If you're quick to the party, however, you can get the badge set at a small discount! This early bird will not be available after the first 24 hrs.

This set of five badges are made from die struck metal and soft enamel colors. Each badge comes with a butterfly catch.
Designed in house at Triple Ace Games, the Mythos Badges are a unique collectible item. These exclusive badges will only be available from this Kickstarter and if in stock from our trade stand at conventions. We won't be making them available in our online store after this Kickstarter ends!
Necronomicon Book Badge
Arguably the most damnable document ever penned in the history of humanity, the Necronomicon concerns matters and entities beyond the understanding of sane men. It speaks of elder gods and spaces between reality, of insidious words that can drive men to madness, of lost cities inhabited by creatures that defy the laws of nature, and of a time before time when terrible things walked upon the earth and swam in the sea. It is a book from which a magician might acquire great power, if he is prepared to pay the terrible price.
Unaussprechlichen Kulten Book Badge
Written by Friedrich Wilhelm von Junzt (1795-1840) and published in 1839, the text (also known as the Black Book) details a number of vile cults. Some appear fictional, their existence being placed at a date before the accepted creation of the first civilizations. Others concern more recent, yet no less barbaric cults.
King in Yellow Book Badge
The King in Yellow is a forbidden play. Its name is well known to actors through hearsay and gossip, yet few have ever seen a copy. Even so, it is greatly feared among thespians. Written in two acts for three characters, Cassilda, Camilla, and the King in Yellow (a malevolent supernatural figure of mysterious origin), merely the act of reading the play can cause madness or despair.
Cultes des Goules Book Badge
Denounced by the Church on its publication, this text graphically exposes the vile arts of necromancy, necrophagy, and necrophilia practiced by a cult in France.
Cthulhu Cultist Badge
The cult of dread Cthulhu has existed since the dawn of mankind and continues to plot the ascension of its master to this day. In order that cultists might recognize each other, they sport pins or tattoos of the abominable Great Old One.

campaign.story:
“If thou but settest foot on this path, thou shalt see it everywhere.” 
― Hermes Trismegistus
The Great Work begins with two symbols of traditional alchemy, mercury and sulfur presented as 1.5" soft enamel lapel pins. These pins combine a black soft enamel with a shining nickel finish to make stylish and subtle accessories to any ensemble. They will be shipped to you on a backing card bearing the Strix Publishing logo, appropriate for gift giving.
Drawn from Strix Publishing's upcoming art book, APOCRYPHA: The Art of Jason Soles, this set of symbols is the work of talented designer Iphigenia, of Foie Gras. This Kickstarter campaign's graphic design is the work of longtime Strix Publishing contributor, Ed Bourelle, of SkeletonKey Games.
All 7 additional pin stretch goals have been unlocked. Thank you!
If you would like to back for multiples of a single pin design please send a PM and you'll be given your choice after the campaign ends. 
Different monitors may present these mockup pins in differing sizes. Actual production size is 1.5" x 1.3"
  Called “quicksilver” by the ancients, mercury is one of the three primes of alchemy and one of the seven planetary metals. Associated with spirit, mercury represents the transcendence of states. Mercury is both solid and liquid, heaven and earth.
Sulfur is also one of the tria prima, the fundamental aspects of human identity as defined by the alchemist Paracelsus. Sulfur was believed to embody the emotions and desires of humanity, separate from the higher faculties of the spirit. This variant of the sulfur symbol is also known as the Leviathan Cross. 
Whether in terms of practical chymistry or as a metaphorical journey of personal transformation, the ultimate application of alchemy is the transmutation of base materials into gold. Gold represents the perfection of all matter, all states. Mind, spirit, and soul, when refined will become this superlative metal. The symbol for gold is also used in astrology to represent the sun.
Earth is one of the four Hellenic elements of ancient Greek ghilosophy, one of the founding bodies of knowledge upon which classical alchemy was based. It is associated with concepts of solidity, immovability, and the physical world. Its associations with ancient mystery cults and cthonic deities has also lent it significance in matters of sensuality and death.
Invert the symbol of earth to use it as the symbol of air. This symbol is linked with the atmosphere and its resultant weather, and is associated with intelligence as one of the Hellenic elements. More recent occult traditions have linked the element of air with elemental entities known as sylphs. The Hermetic Order of the Golden Dawn associates air with the eastern cardinal point in ritual, guarded by the First Watchtower.
Antimony is an unusual element known to mankind since the most distant times when pre-dynastic Egyptians used it to create kohl eyeliner. To the alchemist, antimony is a cooperative metal, best used in combination with another metal such as lead to produce complex reactions. In alchemical terms it is a protective metal—though scientifically classified as a metalloid—and associated with concepts of adaptability and cooperation. It represents the wisdom and strength gained by the sharing of strength and unique talent. Antimony further represents the balance of animal nature within the human spirit and when worn as a sigil is a potent reminder of inner strength.
One of the most abundant elements in the universe, and another of the seven metals of alchemy, iron is associated with concepts of aggression and power. This symbol is also used in astrology to signify the planet Mars. As a sigil, use it to manifest emotions of confidence, physicality, strength, and lust. Iron is the metal most closely associated with the "human" state and is therefore anathema to spirits and disincarnate entities.
Arsenic is a notorious metalloid that was utilized in many alchemical processes and today it is a common element used in the production of pesticides, herbicides, insecticides, and many industrial alloys. Traditionally, the alchemists treated arsenic with a wary respect. Despite its toxicity it was a necessary element in many medicinal and magickal cures. Indeed, it is said that a compound of arsenic and sulfur could induce enlightening trances...Wear the symbol of arsenic when you wish to wield the strength of poison and ward off unwanted advances.
Lead is the the prima matera, the primal matter. The basest element, it represents the putrefaction and decay necessary for new life. Alchemy is concerned with the transformation from base to pure and therefore lead is as important to the alchemist as gold. In astrology, the alchemical metal of lead is associated with the god Saturn and therefore concepts of generation, dissolution, plenty, wealth, periodic renewal and liberation. This symbol mimics the scythe of Saturn, and bears a shape in parts derived from the old Hebrew letter Taw, and the ancient Greek Tau.
The strix was a flesh eating bird of ill-omen, walking on four taloned legs, and bearing a razor-sharp beak, in the myths of the ancient Greeks. The earliest known tale of the strix is from Metamorphoses in which Polyphonte and her sons Agrios and Oreios were punished for acts of cannibalism. Polyphone was cursed to becom a creature "that cries by night, without food or drink, with head below and tips of feet above, a harbinger of war and civil strife to men." References to the strix are found throughout the surviving works of antiquity through the days of the Roman Empire and survived into the middle ages, where its name became entangled with the Romanian word for vampire, strigoi, and creatures that scream in the night like the Strigăt barn owl.

If you'd like to order more pins than alloted in the rewards simply click the “manage your pledge” button on the project page. Then, increase your pledge by $10 per additional pin.

A campaign to fund a new resin sculpt and some stickers.
I made my first sculpt last year to co-inside with my second solo exhibition 'the Peopel & Other Works' at Brush Gallery, Brighton. I made a small edition of 15, which is now sold out.
The idea was to bring these characters off their pages and make them real, or at least solid. These simple human forms have been the basis of much of my work for a few years now.
I'm often asked what they are, and what they mean to me.
To me they are humanity broken down to its most basic form. Ego-less, Race-less, Gender-less, without bias or hatred and live to love each other and the earth.
Every aspect of these sculpts are hand made. They are created using a polymer clay, baked, then roto cast by my friend Ewan (Hollow Planet Designs). The finish is very much that of the original model, all bumps and dents included, they are by no means a perfect manufactured toy, on purpose!
Another aspect of this campaign is your chance to own one of the previously sold out sculpt No.1. These will be a second edition, to separate them from the first they'll be black.
Thanks for reading! Keep up to date with me on instagram @willbloodartist

campaign.story:
A photographic document of all the remaining Pie and Mash shops in London. A limited edition photo book with only 100 printed copies.
As part of Kickstarters MAKE/100 project we are limiting our campaign to 100 backers. 
Pie and Mash London is a documentary of London’s historic pie and mash tradition. Pie and mash is a traditional London working-class food, originating in London. Pie, mash and eel shops have been in London since the 19th century, and are still common in East and South East London and in many parts of Kent and Essex.
The aim of this project is to fund the printing of 100 limited edition A5 landscape books. We will make 100 signed copies available to backers of this kickstarter campaign. When it has been successfully funded we will print an extra 30 unsigned and unnumbered editions and donate them to each of the pie and mash shops as reference copies.
Why this? Why now? 
In 2015 Jake Green and Simon Poon Tip decided to collaborate to produce Pie and Mash a film as part of the 32LDN creative project. During that documentary project Jake took stills at each shop, documenting each exterior. The result is a limited edition collection of photography that serves as a directory of pie and mash shops in London and a printed accompaniment to the film they produced.
As life-long inhabitants of London, Simon Poon Tip and Jake Green have witnessed the continued development of the city over the years, something that inspired them to capture this freeze frame in pie and mash history. Since shooting the film between 2014 and 2015, four of the featured pie and mash shops have closed down. They have been included in this printed edition as a reference to the changing face of London’s pie and mash culture. 
A mock-up of the letter pressed cover
This limited edition photobook designed by the Bread Collective will have an editorial contribution from John Rogers and hand printed letter press editions by Russell Frost of Hooksmith Press.
The book itself will be digitally printed and saddle stitched by Park Communications with a GF Smith cover in Lockwood Green Colourplan and a title hand letterpressed in black ink on the cover. 
A mock-up of the gold foiled cover
The book will consist of 40 pages including 30 B+W images of the exterior of every single remaining pie and mash shop in London.
John Rogers is a writer, film-maker and author of This Other London - Adventures in the Overlooked City.
Bread Collective are an award-winning design collective based in East London.
Russell Frost is a letterpress artist running Hooksmith Press, a small letter press shop based in East London.
Jake Green is freelance photographer based in London, author of The Bookmaker’s Studio
Simon Poon Tip is a D&AD and BRIT award winning creative producer.
32LDN is a project directed by Simon Poon Tip that aims to collectively build a picture of today's London, through the participation of people from all walks of life.
We would also like to thank www.pie-n-mash.com a great resource for us while we were planning our documentary.
Tower Bridge pie and mash shop. Opened in 1892.
A layout example of the final book
The names of all the shops included

updates.update_content: Hello everyone!  Just wanted to shamelessly plug my Merry Resistmas shirts for the holiday season.

A REACTION
By now we all know about the mass shooting in Las Vegas.  If we are going to change how guns are viewed in the United States we need to stand up to the NRA and let gun owners know that gun rights aren't absolute rights. The 2nd Amendment is an amendment to the US Constitution.  By it's very nature it's something that can be changed.

The ineptitude of donald trump knows no bounds. His utter incapacity to actually govern during a crisis is threatening the lives of American citizens in Puerto Rico. We need to look out for our own since the current occupant of the White House is too busy tweeting about non-issues. To that end I’m doing something.

As you all know, there is some even MORE crazy stuff happening in Washington than there was when I last posted an update.  Instead of going over everything - as if I had the time to collect and annotate every misstep and egregious action by the current occupant of the White House and his administration - I thought I would share this powerful post by Dan Rather.  
______________________________________________________________________________

By now, many of you will have received your RESISTOR pins.  I've been getting a lot of positive feedback from those that have - and a few photos on social media!  (It's very neat to see these pins out in the world!)

campaign.story:
You've met with a terrible fate, haven't you?
Majora’s Mask took the basic framework that Ocarina of Time had been built upon and made everything that little bit smarter, that little bit darker and that little bit weirder.
It’s that weirdness - the sense of dread and the unnerving tone that permeates its entire experience - that made Majora's Mask resonate with so many N64 players. The recent remake for the Nintendo 3DS is testament to its timelessness as the game, along with its transformation and time travel mechanics, holds up just as well today.
Pins
To celebrate my love for Majora’s Mask, I’ve designed a set of 3 enamel pins representing the 3 core transformations Link undergoes throughout his adventure - The Deku Scrub, the Goron and the Zora. These will be black nickel plated, 4 colour, hard enamel pins.
Poster
To accompany the pins, I’ve also designed a poster inspired by Majora’s Mask. Risograph printed here in Edinburgh by Workhorse Press on 200GSM A3 uncoated off-white recycled paper.
Early Adopters
And that’s not everything. You super speedy early adopters will also get a totally free Bunny Hood badge. My, what long ears you have…
Pins and posters all ship worldwide!
Depending on the success of this campaign, I’ll also be looking to design some more mask pins and I’ll be consulting with backers to determine what’s next!
Believe in your strengths... Believe...
(The Legend of Zelda is a registered trademark of Nintendo of America)

My apologies for the holdup with shipping. It has been the posters that have caused the delay. After a string of misunderstandings, miscommunication and less-than-perfect prints, we are now going ahead with our third printer - the superb Hato Press in London. campaign.story:
We all remember and love the MagSafe connector on Mac. However the new MacBooks now have USB-C power jacks. It's just not the same anymore.
 And we hope to bring an even better magnetic connector to your laptop.
So we would like to bring you the “Snapnator". And look how simple and convenient it is to use.
Don't let your laptop get yanked to the floor.
It doesn't matter which way you connected, right side up or upside down.
The Snapnator has even greater magnetic coupling then the traditional MagSafe connector.
Most magnetic couplings, have a magnet on one side and iron on the other side. With the snap we spared no expense. We put a magnet on both sides.
Our adapter is the sleekest and smallest magnetic adapter ever made. Because our adapter works for USB type C, it will work for all your USB type C devices. Now magnetic power connectors are available for PC devices and even many phones.
Snapnator on MacBook Pro 2016 13"
Kickstarter backers get an additional 6 months of warranty beyond the standard 12 month warranty available to post-Kickstarter buyers. Get yours now.

campaign.story:
Help make Spinpal Mini a reality today by backing one of the rewards on the right-hand side of this page. Thank you for your support!
The Goal
To design and create a high performance, multifunctional, customizable, and affordable fidget toy spinner. I had used several different fidget toys and all of them work great but none of them checked all the boxes on my wish list. So, I created Spinpal which was fully funded on Kickstarter in December of 2016.
While finalizing Spinpal's design I received a lot of great feedback from family and friends. Kids absolutely loved Spinpal, but I soon realized a smaller version of Spinpal would be even more useful for kids and everyone who loves fidget spinners. My wife, a teacher, has seen the benefits that fidget toys can have in the classroom.  She had the great idea of turning Spinpal into the first pencil topper fidget spinner and Spinpal Mini was born. Spinpal Mini has all the same functionality as Spinpal but in a smaller package which also allows it to become a pencil topper. Spinpal Mini is portable, durable, and easy to use.
Funds are needed to scale manufacturing which will reduce production time and increase part quality. Every Spinpaler (Spinpal-Backer) is important to us and the key to Spinpal’s success. Please don’t hesitate to contact us and share your questions or concerns.
Meet Spinpal Mini
Prototype Top
Prototype Bottom

Spinning Mini
Interchangeable Blades
3D Printed ABS blades can be changed by pressing the center bearing out of the assembly. This allows for changing the look of your Spinpal Mini on the fly.  Additional Blades will be avalibale as an add-on item on BackerKit.
Blades
Ball Bearing
Extreme performance and high quality ceramic hybrid bearing with stainless steel races and ceramic balls.
Steel Weights
Three steel balls maximize spin performance and can snap in and out for an added fidget function.
Steel Weights
Pencil O-Rings
O-rings which allow Spinpal Mini to be placed anywhere along the length of a pencil so you can find your perfect balance.  Spinpal Mini works on any writing utensil that can pass through the bearing.
Removable Center Stud
Center Stud helps you hold Spinpal Mini when using it as a hand spinner. The center stud also allows the user to use the top spin and flat spin.
Pencil O-Rings / Removable Center Stud
Size

Functions (see demo video above)
Snap
Pull out steel ball and snap back into place.
Roll
Grab on to one of Spinpal’s three steel balls and rotate in between fingers.
Slide
Remove center stud and slide on flat surface like Shuffeboard puck.
Hand Spin
Grasp Spinpal Mini’s center stud handle in between your pointer finger and thumb (top and bottom orientation does not matter). Then use your other hand to let it rip. Don’t worry; Spinal Mini has been tested to spin even in the smallest of hands, including children as young as 2 years-old.
Top Spin
Place Spinpal Mini’s center stud ball down on a flat surface. Then support Spinpal Mini by its three arms and spin like a top.
Flat Spin
Place Spinal Mini’s center stud flat side down on a level surface. Then push down on the top of the center stud and spin.
Pencil Topper Spin
Slide one pencil o-ring onto the pencil, then slide Spinpal Mini onto the pencil. Next, slide another pencil o-ring onto the pencil and smash the Spinpal Mini in between the two o-rings. Position Spinpal Mini where ever you would like.
Center Spin
Hold Spinpal Mini in one hand and use thumb to spin the center stud only.

campaign.story:
Why X-DICE?
I've always loved graphic design, and modelling, but the hours upon hours of work and practice was spent only for my own enjoyment. So I thought, why not use my skills for product design, to produce something that other people will get to enjoy as well as myself? I went through numerous objects deciding what to design, and eventually arrived at dice. They are relatively unchanged, with the only considerable changes being color, so I thought there was perfect room for design, which is where X-DICE began.
 The Project
As a tabletop gamer and dice collector myself, I know that you can never have too many dice, someone always loses or forgets their set on game night, so having spares is useful. Not only that but having a wide variety of styles and designs makes the game that much more enjoyable.
  When I began working on the dice I wanted to create a sharp and futuristic design, while still holding true to the original form. Which spawned "X-DICE". The dice have the same impact corners as normal dice would, making sure that the dice are as mathematically accurate as possible. But also have interesting engravings and exciting color schemes to bring them to life. 
X-DICE will be available in pairs; from a single pair, to a large amount for retail.
Models
Have made 3D models for the dice that have been used for prototyping. Below you can view the model of the D6 yourself --> here <--
D6: X-DICE - Kouzex Design by kouzex on Sketchfab
The dice went through multiple physics simulations, and when they passed they were made into 3D printed prototypes. Here you can see them being rolled to ensure that they are correctly proportioned and made even to be as accurate as possible.
PLAY

Colors
X-DICE will be available in Green at launch, then more colors are to be made available when the stretch goals are met. These colors are; White, Red, Blue, as seen below
Stretch Goals
In order to make more colors available, we need more funding to pay for the extra cost of having these colors. And you can help reach these by sharing the campaign with your friends!
Black and Green (Launch): UNLOCKED
Black and White ($13,000): LOCKED
Black and Yellow ($16,000): LOCKED
Black and Blue ($19,000): LOCKED
Black and Red ($22,000): LOCKED
Backers Color Request ($25,000): LOCKED
ALUMINIUM: ($35,000): LOCKED
More Colors, Aluminium: ($50,000): LOCKED
Production
In order for the design to be produced effectively and efficiently, a two-color injection molding process will be used. This costs a fair amount more than the usual injection molding procedure, but is worth it to get the color scheme that is wanted; and is much cheaper than painting.

The Future
If X-DICE is successful, after the campaign is over, and the products are shipped, I will be starting work on a polyhedral 7-set of X-DICE. These will all follow the same aesthetic design, but in a traditional full set of RPG dice.
Shipping
Postage for the dice will be free in the USA, and +$2 for international.
Thank You!
Thank you for supporting the campaign for X-DICE! With more support more dice and other items will be designed and produced in the future! So keep an eye out! And share it around!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I have taken every step possible in order to ensure that the production stage goes as smoothly as possible, and have allocated more than the planned time to ensure that the dice will be shipped when said.

The manufactory process could cause complications with molds, but that is easily fixed with a prototype mould made to check, and then a manufactory mould made after it is proven to be correct.

And at any point there are events that do not go to plan, backers will be notified instantly, and reassured that everything is being done to get past the issue, and back on track.

campaign.story:
What we found 
Have you ever opened your MacBook Pro and discovered marks and nicks on the screen? 
These can be caused by the edges of the keyboard keys touching the screen when the computer is in a bag and under pressure. 
Small marks caused by the edges of the keyboard keys
 The solution  
With equal focus on form and functionality, we created a simple protective pad for your MacBook Pro.
Your screen is protected from dirt, grease and sharp keyboard edges
  Surface graphics are laser etched into the Hypalon
Introducing Keypad  
Place Keypad over your Mac’s keyboard/ trackpad and close your Mac as normal. The super strong, thin material forms a barrier between your keyboard (and the natural oils that build up from your finger tips) and the screen.
Keypad sits between your laptop's keyboard and the screen
When you’re working on your laptop, you can use Keypad as a vibration absorbing mat for your external hard drives (great for designers/ video editors), or as a mouse mat.
Keypad makes a great hard drive mat. Its rubber properties help absorb vibrations from the spinning disk for a quieter working environment.
  Use Keypad as a mouse mat when you're working at your laptop
Design + Materials  
Since 2015 we’ve been making super high quality products out of the best materials and components in the world, and Keypad is no exception.
Each Keypad is laser cut from a sheet or black/ grey Hypalon. The laser finishes the edges as it cuts giving a perfect, burn free edge.
Testing  
We created Keypad for ourselves and we’ve been using Keypad in the studio for 6 months now. It’s become one of those ‘what did we do before’ products.
Almost as soon as we started using the prototypes, we were approached by co-workers asking where they could get one. That’s when we decided to offer it to the Kickstarter community.
Size
Keypad has been designed to fit 13" & 15" MacBook Pros. 
It measures 295mm x 130mm and less than 1mm thin.
We designed Keypad for MacBook Pros, but it will work with many laptop designs, both Mac and PC.
What happens next?
Funding successful 
Final design lock 
Production samples made and quality controlled 
Production run 
 Packing and shipping
Why Kickstarter? 
As early adopters, we want the Kickstarter community to be the first to get their hands on this great, simple product. If this product existed, we’d back it. But it didn’t so we made it ourselves.
Please share this project 
Help spread the word using the social links. Even if you don’t back, sharing is super helpful!
Thank you
We are really excited to take this project to the next step and with your help, we can make it happen.

The Story
Outroute 12 is about a young woman who sets out looking for adventure, touring Trekstops throughout the galaxy to promote her music.
Along a desolate stretch of deep space, she is confronted and must escape an alien threat.
If you are a fan of movies like Joyride or Duel and classic sci-fi comics, you'll enjoy this retro road-trip mashup.
   What's Needed
The production of Outroute 12 is 100% completed.  Story, Art, Colors, Letters, all done. Just need to finish up some of the art for a couple rewards, and send it all to the printer. I am using print on demand companies for printing the book and most rewards. This allows me to keep the funding goal low on this, my initial Kickstarter project. All funds are going to the printing of books and rewards. More funds equals more books.
  Sample
  The Team
Exceptional interior colors were handled by the always professional Evan Evans. (yeah, he has two first names. I thought it was weird too.) Irene Burbee helped out flatting some of the pages for Evan. Also big thanks to Richard Mann of Floating Dock Comics and Curtis M. Lawson for donating some of the comics in the Digital Bundle reward.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is the first Kickstarter I have ever run, but I've read the books, listened to the blogs, crunched the numbers, and feel I am as prepared as I can be. That being said, I am well aware there are plenty of things that can and will go wrong. 

The good news is the book is done. I am still collecting some of the guest art for the back-matter gallery, and finishing art for some of the rewards, (stickers, book mark, etc.) but these are minor things and I'm confident we will be ready to send everything off to the printer as soon as the funds are released.

The books will be printed in the U.S.A., I have both digital print on demand and offset printers that I work with to alleviate a lot of the problems associated with overseas printing.

Shipping and fulfillment is where a lot of the problems can occur. I've made several trips to the post office with samples of everything and feel I'm as prepared as I can be. I promise you ( the Backer ) will be the first to know if I stumble, and what I plan to do to fix it.

campaign.story:
HIGHEST FUNDED MULTI-TOOL
A BIG thank you to all our backers for making the Talon the highest funded multi-tool in Kickstarter and crowdfunding history!
SHIPPING IN TIME FOR THE HOLIDAYS
Manufacturing has already started! Shipping in early December. Get the perfect holiday gift: Talon.
TALON TOP TEN
Lightweight – 40% lighter than titanium
Tough – strong as die cast metal
Tech Friendly – does not scratch your phone or camera
17 tools in one – gets you out of trouble
Adaptable – swappable hex tools to customize your carry
Airplane Friendly – TSA compliant for carry-on
Compact – smaller form factor than a credit card
Advanced Material – composite used in aerospace and military
Pocket Friendly – perfect for everyday carry
Australian – designed + manufactured in Melbourne
      A TOOL WHEN YOU NEED IT  
How often do you find yourself in need of a tool for a quick fix? A loose screw, a non-twist bottle, a package to open. Often, the tool you need is buried in a drawer or lost in the garage, turning a 20 second job into 5-10 minutes.
Or worse, you find yourself in a tricky tool situation away from home.
Talon is the tool you keep with you. It's lightweight, compact, versatile and just might be your new best friend.
BREAKTHROUGH IN DESIGN & TECH
Designed by Chijoff+Co, an internationally award-winning industrial design firm, the Talon is the perfect balance of design and function. Not only does the unique composite material make it ultra lightweight and strong, it's the secret to Talon's patent pending design.
  Holds 2 interchangeable hex bits
The unibody Talon features a compartment that holds two hex bits. This is a design feature that is only possible with the advanced composite material.
Talon is truly unique. 40% lighter than titanium yet as strong as die cast metal and does not scratch your phone.
 STRETCH GOALS
We are happy to announce that all stretch goals have been reached and available and most importantly FREE. 
Stretch goal #1 - All hex bits for Talons and toolpacks come with a titanium coating for extra wear resistance. Its also makes them bling worthy with the gold finish.
Stretch goal #2 - Everyone who orders a toolpack receives a free elastomer holder for their bits.
  The Talon adapts to your needs and ensures you have the tools to tackle any challenges. The internal storage compartment allows you to pick and choose the tools you might need for your next outing. Maybe it's snowboarding, cycling or about town. It's your choice and the Talons got your back.
  The Talon is a world first patent pending design with a number of unique features:
 All the tools you need    The Talon comes with 17 tools featuring metric and imperial wrenches and rulers, box cutter, bottle opener and comes standard with phillips and flat head hex drives. 
Adaptable
Swap out the hex drives for your next adventure. Whether you need allen head through to torx, the Talon holds any standard 1/4” hex drive to ensure it moves with you.
Integrated socket
The Talon makes using the screwdriver a pleasure by putting you in control. The original socket design allows your hand to be positioned similar as you would with a regular screwdriver. A feature that many pocket tools can't do.  
Internal storage
The Talon lets you store 2 standard hex drives within its body. A flexible elastomer keeps the tools locked in place and ready when you need them.  
Lightweight  40% lighter than titanium the Talon is perfect to go where ever you do. Compact Packing over 20 tools in a pocket sized carry.   
Unibody design
The main body of the talon is made from a single material resulting in increased strength , stiffness and badassness
Technology friendly
The advanced composite material allows you to carry your talon without fear of scratching your latest phone or tablet (unlike other multitools)
TSA compliant
The Talon complies to current TSA requirements for air travel.
The Talon pushes the limits of material technology and functionality. The patent pending design is only possible through the use of the advanced composite material. This super strong material enables the dual purpose storage compartment to function as a socket.
  The Talon is made in Melbourne, Australia. We will be using the same factory that produces our current One bottle opener and have worked closely over the last few months on perfecting the design for manufacture. This collaboration ensures that everyone involved has a deep understanding of the project and the standards we expect. Having a local manufacturer means that that we have reduced the risks normally associated with overseas manufacture. No waiting on shipments, faulty products and delivery delays. We will be right there in front of the machine as they come off the line. It doesn't get any more personal than that.
Tooling commenced! Yes that's right. Normally campaigns wait till the funds are received but we made the decision to launch into the production process. As a result we are already a number of weeks into tooling the molds needed for production and expect them to be ready in the next few weeks. As a result we will be delivering the Talons in time for Christmas.
          1. Pick your reward
2. Choose your adds-ons (optional)
3. Press the pledge button
  After many years of designing award winning products for clients we are excited to be bringing original innovations through our own brand Tactica. It’s been 2 years since our first Kickstarter campaign and we are back with our newest innovation the Talon. We are a passionate group of designers with a diverse range of experiences and knowledge. We love the detail and work in great depth to design products from the ground up.
 Marketing Partners
Pre-marketing, strategy, and campaign marketing by Crowdlift.
  End of campaign advertising by Jellop.

We are working with the same supplier we used for our first campaign and have shipped thousands of products around the world. We also have the necessary distributors lined up to ensure smooth shipment around the world.

In short we know what we are doing and you should be confident that we will deliver what we say we will, when we say we will. Should any unforeseen issue arise, rest assured that we will handle them and ensure you are informed throughout the process. We appreciate the support and faith our backer have placed in us and is something that we care deeply about. Just like the Talon, we've got your back.

Supply chain Risk: We are very proud to work closely with our manufacture and as they are local we are able to be onsite during production. They have been involved with the project since its concept so understand our requirements in detail. This ensures quality product is made and ready to ship in time for Christmas. As we are not manufacturing overseas we do not have any risk of delays waiting for goods, quality inspections, customs, etc.

One thing we've learnt after designing many products is that no matter what problems are presented there is always a solution. We always work hard to find the answers and the solutions that work.

Already started:
Everything is ready to go. We have also started the tooling process to ensure we could hit Christmas delivery. Kickstarter holds a special place for us as it is where Tactica was born. This is why we wanted to launch the Talon on Kickstarter and give everyone an opportunity to support our next adventure.

campaign.story:
We all have certain habits we are not proud of —
be it smoking, lack of exercise, addiction to social media, biting nails, plain laziness, tiny or big habits, they shape our daily lives, and often not in a good way. New Year’s resolutions don’t work, because a few weeks later we just forget about them, right?
BAD HABIT COIN is a great tool shaped by our own experience — a visual reminder to take control of your habits that is integrated into your daily routine.
A daily reminder of your resolution to change a chosen bad habit, integrated into simple and handy object -
If you want to get rid of a certain habit you don’t like, go for the Iconic coin which depicts a number of common habits anyone would be better off without. 
For getting rid of your very own, specific habit, choose the Now Is the Time coin that lets you assign your own meaning to it. Not happy with your procrastination ? Habit of making excuses? Are you driven crazy by your constantly being late? Or maybe you always forget to floss your teeth?
Finally, we also offer a special Lazy coin for one’s favorite addiction — laziness.
Be it physical or mental, habits of laziness hold us back. Let the Lazy Coin tackle the problem by reminding you about your own type of laziness and serve as a red flag for action.
 Any questions or suggestions? Feel free to email us at theworkofmind@gmail.com
It is essential for the success of your BAD HABIT COIN that you can always see it. That is why we created the coin stand, so you could visibly place THE BAD HABIT COIN right where you spend most of your time.
Made from Birch Wood. Designed in four vivid colours — red, mint, yellow and white. It will look good on your table at work or home and will always catch your attention at the precise moment you need it most.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
With your support, we will be able to fulfill all of our production goals on a greater level than ever before. While we will do our best to assure that each and every Bad Habit Coin ships properly, there are many variables in the production and shipping process that may cause minor delays – however we have vetted all the relationships necessary to provide quality products in any size order.

One primary challenge of this campaign is making sure that our product stands up to the quality we are looking to imbue within the design. In order to make sure this happens, we are using coin mints which have been around for decades, and we perfected all of our prototype designs long before launching this project.

In order to streamline production, we have performed a few small batch tests on our own – and the process works. We really look forward to producing Bad Habit Coins on a larger scale, and can't wait to grow this product across the Kickstarter community.
