campaign.story:
This is the Kickstarter campaign for Issues 3 and 4 of the NESS series - returning backers can grab just the new books, and new backers can pick up the whole mini-series!
If this is your first encounter with Ness, click HERE for a 7 page preview of Issue One.
What is NESS?
NESS is a four-part, full colour comic miniseries set in Scotland, on the world-famous shores of Loch Ness. It has monsters, action, adventure, scares, creepy bad guys, a good dose of Lovecraftian cosmic horror, and a lot of twisted Scottish mythology.  
I wanted to give the UK its very own giant monster (Japan has Godzilla, America has Cloverfield and, er, sometimes Godzilla...) because giant monsters are endlessly fascinating to me. Where better to set the story than the home of everyone's favourite cryptozoological creature, the Loch Ness Monster?  
Loch Ness is one of the most inspiring places I've ever been. It's an excellent location and I'm excited to set a story there. Real-world buildings and areas will show up in the story, though most of it his invented/adapted.
This is the THIRD 'NESS'-related Kickstarter we've run. 
Take a look at the Issue One launch campaign here. 
And go here to see the campaign for Issue Two! 
Both went incredibly well. Now, all of the rewards for the second campaign have been posted out, lots have already landed with people, and we're coming up to our last comic convention of the year... so I figured now was as good a time as any to launch the new campaign! We're doing two books in one this time, and hope to get both out to you before the end of the year. This rounds out the story, all finished. End of a rather short era.
Here are the two new main covers!
The Rob Carey cover for Issue Three
  The Rob Carey cover for Issue Four
They're designed to be placed next to each other to create a big wide piece of gore! This will be available a print, without the text. See further down the page for info...
Also, as always we have VARIANT COVERS! I print only as many of these as I need to fulfill the Kickstarter rewards, so if you want them, now is the time to get them. They won't be available at cons.
On Issue 3 Variant Cover duties is CONOR BOYLE. Stunningly handsome chap, one half of indie comic legends Disconnected Press, and artist on Titan Comics' new shark book HOOKJAW (written by Si Spurrier). Digitally tinkered with by me, Chris.
Issue Four's Variant Cover is by the friggin' excellent LUKE PARKER. He's the artist on MERRICK: THE SENSATIONAL ELEPHANT MAN written by my con-buddy/co-idiot Tom Ward, and has also worked with industry giant Joe Casey on an issue of his series 'Sex'. Luke is great, his work is great, everything is great.
  NESS is the story of CEIT and her friends on a trip to the Loch to scatter the ashes of Ceit's late mother. They just so happen to arrive the morning after the Loch's final protector is killed by one of the many beasts he and his small tribe have been warding off. He was the last member of a local cult dedicated to keeping the monsters in check, and with him and his kind now gone, the things that lurk in the deep, dark waters, and hide in the surrounding hills, are free to run riot...  
The series has garnered some nice reviews so far:  
"One issue down and I’m already clambering for the next three." - Gary Watson, Comics Anonymous  
"Having grown up in the region where this comic is set I am thrilled to say that, while Chris might have exercised some creative license in regards to the quantity of tentacles present, Robert Carey‘s art and the gorgeous heathery colours from Dee Cunniffe do bring the Highland glens to life brilliantly – especially the panels at the ruined castle/church on the banks of the Loch. " - Clare's Comics Catalogue, Fandemonium
"NESS is still a fast-paced, energetic monster tale with some truly impressive visual moments." - Ceej, Big Comic Page   
"Ness is a comic worth checking out for fans of Fantasy, Horror or Adventure stories, but not for the feint-hearted. It’s gruesome and gory, and all things wonderful." - Comix Ireland
ISSUE THREE picks up right where the second ends, following the group further into the nightmare of real monsters lurking in the Loch... and beyond. ISSUE FOUR brings the series to a crazy, frantic end. Who will survive? Will anyone?
NOTE: The final product will be coloured in the same lovely way as the first two books, again by arty maestro Dee Cunniffe. Here are a few uncoloured, not-too-spoilery pages from Issue Three to whet your appetite.
If you want to go in cold, scroll past. If this is your first encounter with Ness, click HERE to download a 7 page preview of Issue One as a PDF.
       Now we skip forward a couple of pages...
That's about all I can show without ruining things!  And I really, really don't want to ruin things... I'm exceptionally proud of these books and I think they get better with each one. I'd hate to ruin any of the surprises along the way!
   Now, a closer look at those Art Cards... 
  We've also got some ORIGINAL ART on offer!
Here's ANDY BLOOR's work - check out the Rewards on the right for more info:
 Next up, CONOR BOYLE's art work!
 And finally the CHRIS IMBER original artwork!
  All prints come on high-quality A4 Heavyweight card - printed on 300gsm white recycled board - for a premium recycled finish with a textured look. 
First up is this delicious beauty from the equally delicious Jez Cummings, @Hedninger on Twitter. Jez is a Graphic Design drop-out now pursuing a lifelong love of pin-ups & sequential art. He's done work for @MerrickComic #4 and his first proper comic, 'Battery', should be out early next year. His website is: http://magnumimago.deviantart.com/
This landscape print (our first one!) which stitches together both of the new covers; issue 3 and 4. Art all by Rob Carey! @Mansloth on Twitter - more in his Bio at the foot of the page.
PLUS the Variant Cover by Conor Boyle, which was too good to not do as a print.
Plus fan-favourite Caspar Wijngaard's cover from Issue 2. A lot of people loved it, so now we're offering it as a print. Caspar co-created/drew/coloured LIMBO (Image Comics) along with Dan Watters, and is currently working on the ASSASSIN'S CREED comic series from Titan Comics.
And, finally, the Issue #4 alt cover by Luke Parker, of Merrick: The Sensational Elephant Man, in pin-up form!
    Here's how the ADD-ONS work. Essentially they help you create your own, custom reward level... just in case none of them on the right float your boat. Postage could be a factor (if you live outside of the UK) but I'll keep it as low as I can and get back to you with the final cost as quickly as I can.
Physical Books: All of them are priced at £4 each. Original covers and (if I have any left) the Variants too. Decide which ones you want, add up the cost, and let me know in a message.
Digital Books: £2 each, as above.
Prints: £4 each. Want more than one, but less than 5? (Like the Reward tiers offer...) then pick your favourites, add the cost up, and let me know in a message.
Art Cards: £3. Designed by Tom Mortimer and featuring an extra Ness story written by me.
Tee: £10. We have Male and Female fits - S, M, L and XL in each.
The T-Shirt design, by Ammar Al-Chalabi!
More to come as I think of them...
Chris Welsh - Chris is a comic/screenplay writer who co-created WART, DOC DINO and is now responsible for NESS. No one has produced any of his screenplays. YET. He lives in Liverpool, England with his beloved laptop and too many books. He drinks rum. @C_W_Writes  
Rob Carey - Rob is an illustrator from Dublin, Ireland and has worked on a variety of projects, including comics published in Lightning Strike anthology, North Bend, The Life and Adventures of Sherlock Holmes, and Afterworld. @Mansloth  
Dee Cunniffe - Dee has worked for nearly every publisher as a flatter/colour assistant to some of the world’s top colour artists. Recent credits include The Wicked + The Divine and ODY-C. @Deezoid  
Robin Jones - Rob is a British comic writer, part of the publishing misfits Madius Comics, and letterer. He is always the nominee, never the winner, and the proud owner of both of his kneecaps. You can find him on Facebook at his lettering page RobJonesLetters, or harass him on Twitter at: @RobJonesWrites
Big thanks to James McCulloch for going over the script and making sure I didn't mess up too much of the Scottish dialect.
Stretch Goals, eh? Well we'll deal with these when the time comes, but we've had a novel idea... You've seen the art cards, up there in the reward section? Well on the back of those will be a short written piece by me, giving some history on the story and the Loch itself. Some insight into the situation.
So what we're planning for the Stretch Goals is more of this. More snippets of story in strange formats, building and building for each one we hit. They could be telegrams, notebook entries, strange recordings...basically Tom Mortimer is helping me turn this into a fun little art project that bolsters the Ness story and plays with the medium.
It'll be interesting, and I really hope we get up to hit some of these. As soon as we hit the target I'll announce the Stretch Goal Targets - they'll be small, so we can hit them thick and fast with any luck.
Naturally, everything we produce will ONLY be available through Kickstarter, because we like to spoil our lovely backers.
Speaking of, here are some comments from a few awesome people who backed the first books:  
(I hope you don't mind being quoted... if you do, let me know and I'll edit you out.)  
"Just took my delivery of some quality #comics. NESS by @Mansloth & @C_W_Writes. Looks like a really pretty thing." - Dirk F
"Just sat down and read @C_W_Writes's Ness #2. It's a Great horror series...creepy as hell." - Matt G
"I'm so happy to have backed this project. I will be backing all the issues. Great work, gents." - Nicholas B  
"Got my copy today, great looks, story, monster. Look forward to backing the next three issues." - Jon B  
"No spoilers, but the story is great - pacey and dark with a nice tension throughout. Looking forward to the other books!" - Kevin C  
"I just finished reading Ness and what can I say only WELL DONE! It's a fantastically put together comic. I will be raving about it." - Ciaran M
"This is fine but have you considered replacing the main character with a guy named Wart?" - Ammar Al-C  
"Chris is so much better than me in every way that counts." - Tom W
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This isn't my first Kickstarter rodeo, but I know from experience how things can get a bit hectic.

So far I've successfully run (and delivered on) two campaigns for my other series WART, one for the dinosaur-buddy-cop-surgical-drama DOC DINO, and obviously the first two NESS campaigns.

I've also been involved in the campaign for the horror anthology THE GRIME Issue One and Issue Two.

With Ness #1 we hit a couple of small stumbling blocks that delayed the book's release by a month, but this time we've streamlined and learnt from previous mistakes, so there shouldn't be any such issues this time around.

Ness #2 was actually out two months ahead of schedule thanks to the art team smashing it. That's what made it possible to launch 3 and 4 this year!

With that experience, I'm confident I can deliver Ness Issues Three and Four in a timely fashion, as promised, with my usual high-standards in place.

The scripts are completed for each issue in the four-part series and Rob Carey has near-as-damnit finished the last pages of inks for the whole darn series. Your money will go to colours, finishing the inks, lettering, printing, producing the Kickstarter prints and extras, Kickstarter's fees, and postage. Any extra cash raised will go back into the series, hopefully lowering the already-low goal for future issues.

I've already put up my own cash to fund the preview (and beyond), as well as the production of pin ups and extra artwork. I don't anticipate getting this back, but I strongly believe the investment in this book was worth it.

If there are any hiccups along the way to production, I promise to take responsibility, keep everyone in the loop, and work hard to get this book finished and out there. Having said that, I don't foresee any, unless one of the team is eaten by a giant sinister water-dwelling creature (or drowns whilst hunting one).
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hello everyone!
Just to let you know;
Half the UK-based rewards went out last week, the other half are going tomorrow.
The International rewards all went out today.

Hello everyone
I've had a few questions about when the books will be going out, so here's an update:
They're almost all packed up and a decent chunk have gone out already. So they should start arriving very soon, if they've not already landed on your doorsteps.
If you've messaged me with an address update recently, rest assured I've seen it and taken it into account.
I almost have my living room back, it's currently a comic packin' production line and has been for a while!

updates.update_userinfo: Digital Files and Print Books are ready to go
updates.update_content:
Hello everyone,
Just a quick one...
DIGITAL REWARDS:
These will start going out via KS Message and Email as soon as it's all uploaded to Dropbox. There are PDFs and CBZs of each book, along with the scripts. Some tiers will get the digital files for the prints, art cards, etc too.

updates.update_userinfo: Some news, finally. And an apology.
updates.update_content:
Hello everyone,
I've got some apologies to make. I've been useless these last few months; at responding, at updating, and ultimately at getting these books out and into your hands.
Truth is I've had a very rough few months with my mental health and had to take a step back from comics in order to sort the rest of my life out. I've just started a new business (A bar, we opened a couple of months ago - so far it's been fun but also a series of never-ending headaches), which has eaten up all of my free time since January. On top of that I've had a slew of unpleasant personal issues.

updates.update_userinfo: Ness 3 and 4 update - good news, finally!
updates.update_content:
Hello everyone,
Apologies for the radio silence of late. I was holding out hope that the colours would be finished and I could send out some good news....
...and now they are!
I really am truly sorry for the wait, and wish it had gone differently, but alas...

updates.update_userinfo: Hello everyone! Here's a NESS update-
updates.update_content:
Bad news first: The release date has slipped a bit. This means we won't be hitting our target of getting everything sent out in January.
I'm not keen on sending updates that are essentially 'No news yet', but this one felt necessary.
The reason (and here's the good-ish news) is because Dee Cunniffe, our colourist, got swamped with big gigs - including a new IMAGE book called REDNECK, which you can read about .

updates.update_userinfo: Two days left and another stretch goal down!
updates.update_content:
Yup, with just over two days left we've broken the threshold of another stretch goal, meaning everybody receives the piece of Chris Imber art and a little extra backstory!
As a reminder, it looks like this, and the ORIGINAL PIECE is still available as a reward!

updates.update_content:
Hello everyone! 
One of the pieces of Original Art had now gone! Which means only one remains... 
It's Andy Bloor's awesome piece, here:

campaign.story:
The Vegan Pin: A pin for vegans and animal-lovers alike to celebrate a part of who they are right now and what they're passionate about- animals, conservation, the earth, and more. Find new friends who are plant-based and compassionate!
It's hard to believe, but there isn't a simple, minimal pin for vegans yet. Based off of the "V" found on vegan Lush products, this soft enamel pin is about 1.5", with white enamel surrounding semi-matte black metal plating with a rubber backing. It's intended to serve functionally, no frills; simple, fresh, and empowering!
I've been vegan for about 4 months now, and haven't really told anyone (it's my own thang) because of the stigma against it. I know, I know, call me a weenie vegan- but when something means a lot to me I find myself nervous to speak about it! 
However, I love using pins to speak for me- I've been all over the Internet searching for pins that resonate with me to put on my backpack and walk around with proudly. Feelin' like a Boy Scout with a new badge.
So, with this weenie spirit in hand, I decided to design a pin using one of the most popular vegan symbols, hoping to take care of a few things:
Create a more subtle, aesthetic approach to being proud of who u are (keep it subtle, folks. but not always, i just like saying that phrase. there are no rules.)
Fellow vegans can see your pin and turn u around and give u great hugs because wow another soulmate in this life!! All because the pin led them to you. (Prizes may vary from person to person)
You can be a walking beacon of light spreading awareness for the earthy cause without "being in anyone's face"- a double whammy of increased & individualistic choice of exposure that makes the cause even more appealing and familiar! Have you ever seen a lighthouse walk on two legs to bring ships ashore all over the earth? Exactly. U can be the first of a new wave.
Be yourself, loud n proud. It can be hard sometimes, especially in a culture where one size does not fit all. This pin can help you express yourself in a subtle, empowering way- trust me, you'll forget it's on your backpack after awhile, yet people will still always see the pin! Pins can be worn as subtly or as loudly as you want- that's the beauty of them.
10% of all proceeds are going to Mercy for Animals, one of the leading and most effective organizations helping to turn around how farm animals are treated and perceived today.
I'm a youngin' in college, so I do not have the funds to throw these babies into production to sell myself. And that's why I'm here- to raise the funds necessary to put in the minimum production order of 100 pins and get them out there into the world...and hopefully bring some people together in the process!
I intend to make more pins related and unrelated to plant-based causes that generally encourage people to find self-love and to create their own paths in this world. If this is successful, this will become the first of many.
The goal of this Kickstarter for The Vegan Pin is to sell at least 40 pins, or raise $400, by November 13th; this is enough to put them in production and ship them! However, at that point, I will have at least 60 pins left over due to the minimum requirement for production (100 pins), so the rest will be posted on my site for purchase- in time for Christmas!
Funding Breakdown:
$300: Pin Production
$100: Shipping, packaging, donation to MFA, and Kickstarter fees/processing
Production Timeline:
Announce Kickstarter on Sunday, October 30th
Campaign available until Sunday, November 13th at 10pm
If Kickstarter met, put production order in Monday, November 14th
Receive pins in 3-4 weeks
Ship pins out immediately for pledgers and pre-orders for Christmas

STRETCH GOALS!
£4000 - UNLOCKED - All physical backers get a sticker with some new art from Luke as an extra little thank you from us.
£4500 - UNLOCKED - All physical backers get a full colour A5 print featuring art by Chris Imber to show our appreciation.
We'll have it coloured for the print!
£4750 - UNLOCKED -  Digital 'Making of' Merrick: The Sensational Elephantman #5 for ALL backers!

£5000 - Digital 'Making of' Merrick: The Sensational Elephantman #6 for ALL backers!
Merrick: The Sensational Elephantman is a Victorian gaslamp pulp adventure comic set in 1880s' London. Based on a fictional version of the life of Joseph Merrick, it steps between historical facts and turn of the century folklore juxtaposed with the American superhero comic conventions of super powers, masks, secret identities and fantastic adventures.
Thanks to the amazing Kickstarter community, we were able to create and release the first 4 issues story arc of Merrick. Then we finished a one-shot spin-off, Treves: A Restless Night. Now it's time to continue Joseph Merrick's story so we have returned to Kickstarter to hopefully fund the second arc, The Gambler's Cards, with issues #5 and #6. 
  Many years ago a businessman sold his soul to the Devil in exchange for luck and riches. As he became an old man his fear grew and he became obsessed with escaping his eternal fate. He used his vast fortune to commission his greatest achievement, a magical deck of cards which he still clutches in death.
Now Treves needs the cards to further his own schemes, only every agent he has sent to retrieve them has ended up as a patient in Bedlam Mental Asylum. Can The Elephantman succeed where others have failed? And can he survive his first encounter with Spring Heeled Jack?!
  If you've encountered any of our physical issues of Merrick I'm sure you have noticed the print quality and the nice distinctive feel they have, it's something we feel really passionate about. This is the standard we will be sticking with as we move forward, all our single issues are printed on 120GSM uncoated bond with 300GSM matt laminated covers. We're striving to make every issue of Merrick something special, an item that you will want to keep, these are not disposable comics.   
Both issues are beautifully presented, full colour, standard US size comics. Issue #5 is 32 pages, Issue #6 approximately similar length.
As with all single issues of Merrick, issue's #5 and #6 will be limited numbered runs of 500 never to be reprinted with the same cover. 
A maximum of 2 print runs for each issue.
All single issues are shipped bagged and boarded to ensure they reach you looking as great as they went out. 
We'll also send you digital versions of each issue in .pdf and .cbr formats so you can enjoy issues of Merrick on the move on your tablet, smartphone or PC.
    Although issue #1 of Merrick: The Sensational Elephantman is completely sold out, there is still a chance to build an impressive collection of single issues by picking up copies of the first run of #2 - #4. Limited edition, numbered to 500 copies with less than 80 copies of Merrick #2 left!  
Don't worry about missing any story, you can download issue #01 in .PDF/.CBR absolutely FREE here.
The Merrick Vol.1 Trade Paperback
Joseph Merrick is The Elephantman, the most remarkable human being ever to draw the breath of life! Cursed with hideous physical deformities which grant him enhanced strength and toughness, his skin as thick as his namesake.
Betrayed robbed and left for dead by his tour manager, Merrick drags himself back to London and once again finds himself in the care of Dr Frederick Treves, one of the most well respected surgeons in the country. But is the doctor all that he seems? And will the city's dark underbelly envelop him?
Treves: A Restless Night
Before he met The Elephantman, before he came to be one of the most talented surgeons at the London Hospital, a young Frederick Treves travelled throughout India with a fellow doctor. One night as they set camp in a barren wasteland Treves' travelling companion recounts the tale of a previous encounter with a local who put his faith in a witchdoctor over modern medicine...
Set before the events in Merrick: The Sensational Elephantman, A Restless Night is loosely based upon a true story taken from Treves' journals of his experience travelling through India. It recounts his first encounter with the unexplainable as he fights for his life against a vengeful curse. 
There are around 200 copies left of the first print run of 500 which include a limited edition numbered bookplate signed by Tom and Luke. These will go to the earliest backers who pledge for a copy of this book.

"If Ward & Parker keep putting put books as strong as this, then they will deserve their growing reputation as one of the most exciting teams on the small press scene."
www.pipedreamcomics.co.uk
"Ward & Parker have nailed it and they’ve cemented themselves in the indie/small press scene as a creative team that can hit the heights consistently and by producing something that feels fresh and compelling. Give me more of this please….MORE, MORE, MORE!!!"
ComicsAnonymous
"Brutality and poetry co-exist simultaneously on the same page. It has that sad quality that David Lynch’s movie features, but tackles it in a completely different way. Merrick steps up to the hatred of the city, powerful instead of weak and infatuated. He rails against the injustice of the times and sets out like a pulp novel character cutting a swathe of bloody broken bones through the Hellboy level weirdness of the times."
www.downthetubes.net
"In a way, we all identify with the Elephant Man. How many of us truly enjoy seeing their own reflection? We all have doubts and insecurities about our own abilities and appearance, but what if someone were to come along and show you how to turn those things that you don't like about yourself into your greatest advantage? It's this inversion of the negative that I find empowering about this comic."
You May be Dead and Dreaming 
"Tom Ward and Luke Parker have in four issues created a world richer and more interesting than many books can attain in years, if ever. Ward mixes the real, surreal and downright weird perfectly, without any visible seams. Parker’s art is reminiscent of Mike Mignola’s and he would fit in filling in on any of the Mignolaverse books easily. Parker’s coloring, particularly his use of oranges and blues gives this book its own visual identity. These guys are on their way to bigger things, so get in on the ground floor with Merrick, it is a truly unique read in today’s glut of boring superhero books."

The island
What is Ghost island?
Ghost island is a 43 page Black & white supernatural-thriller comic series.
On a remote island a wealthy entrepreneur has secretly created a theme park full of imprisoned ghosts he has collected over time.
Before opening the attraction to the public he enlists the help of a small group of people to assist him. One of them being Josh Evans a troubled psychic with a dark past. Whilst he battles his own personal demons 
Josh is scheduled the task of crossing over & exploring some of the evil minds of the ghosts that lie within the island,but what cost. 
  Page 1
  Page 2
  Issue 1- THE INVITATION
Josh is not making the money he used to as a psychic thanks to his name being dragged through the dirt in newspapers. He receives an invitation with an offer he simply cannot refuse. 
He is not alone in receiving such an offer. The group journeys to the island, not knowing entirely what to expect. But soon they'll realise hell has a place on earth.
  Struggling to find work as a disgraced psychic the bills pile up
  Josh recieves the invitation meanwhile his dark past lingers as he still tries to unlock the truth
                   £1200: [UNLOCK] Regardless of your reward tier everyone receives an A6 art card of a previously unseen Ghost of Ghost island (and its a gudden) 
Ghost unlock

Hand stamped
      Joseph Oliveira
A filmmaker for the last 10 years Joseph strives to tell a good story. One of his short films in 2010 "Inhibitions" was nominated for a young persons BAFTA award. He continues to push the boundaries of his story-telling as he now brings it to the comic book world.
https://twitter.com/justjoey911
  Anabela Turlione
In the year 2015 Anabela completed her PhD in physics, but since then decided to take a turn in life and devote herself to what she really loves: draw. After training for 6 years in illustration, 2D animation and painting large-format, in 2014 Anabela won two competitions in Argentina, one other national and provincial level that allowed her to fund her first animated short film.
https://twitter.com/anitanimala
  Justin Birch
Born in the hills of West Virginia and raised on a diet of pepperoni rolls and Ecto Cooler Hi-C, Justin surprised everyone by surviving to adulthood. Now he letters comics. His eventual dream is the same as everyone else - to work full time from in his underwear.
https://twitter.com/justinbirch

Kickstarter is a great way to get my project out there and share my project with you. And will really help in bringing the project forward with it going to the printers.

campaign.story:
This will be the second graphic novel by Tom Smith and Katie Whittle from independant comic label Frisson Comics following on from the success of Take Only Photographs, Leave Only Footprints which was Kickstarted successfully earlier this year.
The Story 
The Trade follows the story of Serena, an enigmatic young woman who meets our second protagonist, Alice, in a bar one evening. After taking a liking to one another the pair take off into the night as the tragic, horrific, poignant and occasionally humorous story of Serena's life is slowly revealed over the course of the evening. 
As with our last project we are very keen not to give away too much of the plot as we believe that the fun of the story is for the reader to discover Serena's story for their self. What we will say is that the story is our take on a classical horror genre and touches upon issues such as loss, morality, illness and even a touch of romance. While it is primarily a horror tale we focus as much upon the drama and experiences of our protagonist as we attempt to portray the human side to characters which may not be. 
In our work we are very much interested in creating strong, complex and diverse characters that express and inspire a broad range of emotions. It is something that we believe that we have accomplished with this book.  

Rewards
As with all our work this is a passion project of ours and as such we are only asking for funding for the cost of the initial print run of the book, any extra money we make will go towards stretch goal rewards for our backers: 
As with last time we are offering badge packs and posters to all our physical backers at the £1000 stretch goal tier. Here is an example of what our backers received for our last project: 
Goody bags from our last campaign
Yea re aiming to produce even cooler rewards this time round at a similarly high quality!
As with our last Kickstarter we are offering A5 commissions in watercolour and inks by Katie of whatever you like! Here is an example of some of the commissions produced last time and the quality to expect:
We are offering a limited number of 15 of commissions for this Kickstarter. 


The Art
The art will be hand drawn throughout the comic using a semi brush and dip pen then treated digitally. We do this to give the work a unique, organic visual style that reflects the story and gives the reader a more tactile experience.
Page in Process
    We aim to finish the project with a high quality 80 page one-shot Graphic Novel, if by some good fortune we reach our £2000 pound stretch goal we will give the extra option of upgrading your book to a luxurious hardback edition. If we are successfully funded we will be debuting this book at Thought Bubble Festival 2016 as well as taking it to future conventions to sell while we work on our next book 'The Circus is in Town' by Thomas Kelly.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is our second Kickstarter after our first graphic novel was successfully funded earlier this year. The risk potential for this project is fairly low, as the only costs we need to cover is the cost of an initial print run of 150 copies of the book (possibly more if we reach stretch goals). At of the time of the Kickstarter launch the story is 100% written and pencilled and almost 50% inked and lettered by Katie. Then all we need to do is digitally clean up the pages and then we are ready to go!

The only potential setbacks that we can foresee are the unlikely events of either personal or family emergencies, which at worst, we believe, would only temporarily delay rather than cancel the release of the book. 

We will keep everyone thoroughly informed of our via Kickstarter updates.

campaign.story:
What is this film about? 
Remember when you were a kid? What were the things that were important to you? For some of us, it was video games. If you enjoy the escape to the electronic world, the thrill of the hunt like going to yard sales and flea markets; Reality TV shows like 'American Pickers'- then we’ve got a FILM FOR YOU!
'The Bits of Yesterday'
Among the ever expanding growth of the digital age, where the tangible is becoming less and less everyday, there lives a small niche group of people out there that strive to keep the tactile memories of a bygone era alive.
These are the retro video game collectors! This rather unique mishmash of people relive the past, today, through pieces of plastic and metal. These are their stories and adventures.
So, grab your Power Glove, a juice box and let’s travel through the decades of discarded video games as we delve into flea markets, yard sales and personal collections and meet up with video game junkies. From everyday folks, to Internet personalities to hardcore game collectors, we will trek across the country and show the broad spectrum of this rather unique hobby.
Who are you AND why is this important? 
My name is Darrin Peloquin and this will be my first feature film and I am excited to tell you the untold story of the video game collector. Video games have been an integral part of my life since I first picked up an NES controller at my cousin’s house way back in 1987. Little to my amazement, did I realize that over 25 years later, I would still be playing video games. Collecting merely became the obvious outcome of being a gamer. On top of that conclusion, I found out, through my enthusiasm as a collector, I was not the only one out there pursuing the games of my past. There was a completely unknown subculture of people doing what I was doing. There are many like me preserving the past. Reliving memories and making new ones.
The games of our youth: how we played them, how we acquired games and with whom we play games says a boundless amount about us as a society. We live in a digital age where information is constantly available, whether we like it or not. Behind the curtain of instant gratification, we’ve lost our connection with the outside world. Society has become various media platforms and technology has dulled us to what it was like to interact in-person and to physically engage. We have become many- all with a voice but no one is really listening.
We have forgotten the newsstand, and how that was our means for news and upcoming information; we have abandoned the plethora of knowledge known as the library for a Wiki and we no longer rush to the video stores on Friday nights. We have become an institution that doesn’t socialize in shared experiences first hand anymore.
New gamers do not understand what it was like to be immersed in the time when video games were emerging as an everyday facet of life. They will never know the camaraderie of sharing in what video games were. Sure, the internet brings us all together but never has it separated us more. Just because you may play a video game online with someone, that distance is just merely the fragmented remains of a bygone era. The couch has become another fixture of the home rather than a meeting place.
For me, it’s relieving to be part of a very focused nexus which carries on the past through collecting the games and systems that we grew up with. Along with other enthusiasts, collectors and fans, I’d like to tell you the story of what it was like to trade games, play with others and talk to one another face to face. I want to show you the micro-generation that have become retro game collectors.
This film will offer a glimpse into the paradigm of collecting, the mindset of collectors and show that their ambition and passion still lives on in their hearts. Whether it be for nostalgia or curiosity reasons or other, it’s still out there and going strong today among the horrors of this strange world in which we live. Game collecting today has harnessed what was and what is and the adventures in the film will demonstrate that.
How's the production going, so far?
We are (about) 75% done with the film in terms of shooting and editing. We have met and interviewed a large majority of the people we feel best speak and represent the culture of video game collecting and our core message. From the everyday, casual collector to the Internet personality- we've met a lot but there are still more wonderful people out there we need for the film. These are the "Game Junkies".
We expect the film to be released within the first quarter of 2017. Please read the Risks and Challenges section for more information.
What are "Game Junkies"? 
It's difficult to look at oneself and slap on a label. The collectors and people in the film are just that. They are addicted to game collecting and the journey of trying to collect for their favorite system, whether it be the Sega Genesis or Master System; the Atari 2600 or the unsurpassed Nintendo Entertainment System: the NES. Of course, there are leveling degrees of this fascinating hobby: to collect, play and trade video games. It's their personal recollections and perspectives that The Bits of Yesterday will capture.
Who is involved?
Below is a list of current participants which includes YouTube and Internet personalities, authors, gaming enthusiasts, fans, collectors of the past and more! We are positive more participants will join in on the project as we progress. As stated, our campaign is geared around acquiring more people who speak to the core message of our film concerning collecting; the more we get funded, the more we can include in the film: 
James Rolfe, Filmmaker/Personality (Creator of the ANGRY VIDEO GAME NERD web series)
Reggie Williams, Collector/ Personality (Radical Reggie)
Joe Witter, Collector/ Personality (Crazy Joe)
Pat Contri, Collector/ Personality (Pat, The NES Punk; The Unnecessary Podcast)
Kinsey Burke, Collector/ Personality
Toby Wickwire, Co-founder of the Portland Retro Gaming Expo/Collector
Rick Weis, Co-founder of the Portland Retro Gaming Expo/Collector
Dain Anderson, Founder of NintendoAge/Collector
Scott Zientek, Collector/ Personality (Grimsie42)
Billy and Jay, YouTube Personalities/ Collectors (The Game Chasers)
John Hancock, Collector Extraordinaire
Wood Hawker, Collector/ Personality (Beat ‘Em Ups)
Brett Weiss, Author/ Collector
Jeffery Wittenhagen, Author/ Collector
Michael Thomasson, former Guinness World Record holder for largest video game collection.
John Lester, Game Developer/ Personality/ Collector (Gamester81) …and many more!
How your support helps us!
Our base goal is $10,000 and this will allow us to bring you a documentary film that's over 90 minutes long and very polished, from beginning to end.
Every contribution counts when it comes to producing something of quality. For an independent film like this one, a substantial amount of cost will be put toward travel expenses. This will grant us the ability to interview collectors from around the country that we feel best represent the core message of the film. We have interviewed many key figures in the video game collecting culture but we feel the story isn't complete without a select few.
On the plus side, this film is largely complete! A great deal of the project has already been filmed. We've made it this far along, so there no turning back now!
Other factors and expenses that play into our campaign include perks and fees as well as legal (should anything occur beyond our own capabilities). Furthermore, no film would be complete without a soundtrack. The Bits of Yesterday will also have an amazing music score, so acquiring the right artist/composer has to be accounted for as well designer(s) for promotional t-shirts, posters and cover art, etc.
What's in it for me?
Speaking of perks, we’ve got some pretty good ones lined up to reward you for your support! We will have your usual swag like stickers, posters and T-shirts but we will also have some exclusive rewards including, but not limited to, an Executive Producer film credit all the way up to actually being in the film! Sure, why not! Show us your collection. Bring us to your favorite hunting spots where you find those forgotten, obsolete treasures. Possibly the ultimate experience: being a star!
Remember this: If we get funded beyond our set goal, things can only get better. We could have the option of an International BluRay instead of DVD or even a limited run on VHS! Wouldn't that be something? We could even take the film on the road and showcase it around the country. The possibilities become almost infinite the more we are funded!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Risks & Challenges There are many risks and challenges that this project could run into. The unknowns of people, and places; the weather and the dangers of traveling could put this production in jeopardy. Also, there is participation or lack thereof concerning interviewees, business owners, the general public as well as legal matters that may arise from us and the finished product.

For us, I believe that the bar has not been placed so high as we cannot achieve what we have set out to do. I am positive that we will be successful in our documentary. 

I have chosen this project because it is near and dear to me. My intentions are to share with you a class of people whom have admiration for games, and who are reliving the past through collecting what some consider useless pieces of junk. 

I am eager and ready to battle any and all obstacles concerning the development of this film

campaign.story:
I first saw a fidget spinner while browsing youtube and immediately thought  'want one' , but was put off when I saw the cost. I immediately set to designing a cost effective version which was still high quality and high performance but at a more affordable price. While researching this project, I discovered a number of other 3d printed versions, but I thought they were too big to fit comfortably in the hand or pocket. 
I have spent countless hours developing the P6-Spinner using different combinations of weight and size until I was happy with the combination of spin time and spin speed while maintaining a comfortable size. The overall weight is 60g with the rotating balls weighing in at 42g.
Development Models
 The bearings are a key element to spin times, so after trying many different bearings, I decided to use 'Bones Reds' bearings which are an established and recognised brand of high quality skate bearings.
Bones Reds Bearings
 The P6-Spinner gives satisfying spin times in a high quality unit. I hand finish the body once it comes off the printer to give it a smooth finish which add to it's premium appearance and feel. Using stainless steel hardware and market leading bearings, it really is built to last. 
Spin to your heart's content with the P6-Spinner form Jetset Robot.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I am printing the P6-Spinner myself on a custom P3 Steel to ensure quality control. Should I encounter an issue with the printer, I would be able to repair it quickly using spare parts already on hand. I am in the process of building a second identical printer which will allow the production volume to double for the second batch. If I am lucky enough to exceed the current rewards volume. I can assemble a third and even a fourth printer to ramp up production if necessary. 
The bearings, balls, and screws are all readily available so I cannot see an issue with supply.

Thanks to you, our backers, we successfully funded our debut design, the niXaX, and we are proud to say we have shipped to over 40 countries and with great feedback from our customers! 
The previous Kickstarter project: niXaX - World Most User-friendly Steak Tenderizer
  As a follow-up to our popular niXaX tenderizer, the niXaX light offers the same quality craftsmanship and tenderizing power in a smaller, easier to use model.
  You’re only 10 seconds away from juicy, delicious steaks! You don’t have to be a skilled chef to improve your steak life.
       It takes only Less Than 10 Seconds for one side!
  The niXaX light features an ergonomic design and intuitive functionality. Simply:  
Lay your steak on the cutting board  
Working left to right, stamp the niXaX across the steak  
The precious tenderizing blades push through the fibrous, connective tissue
Cook, serve, and enjoy!   
Unlike other meat tenderizers, the niXaX does not focus on pounding, pressure, or mashing the meat like a tenderizing mallet. Hammering away at your steak flattens the meat, interferes with even cooking, and compresses the tasty, delicious meat like a pancake!
Tenderizing your steak with niXaX breaks up the tough, fibrous tissue that causes chewiness. The gentle piercing of the meat allows for more flavor to enter the steak during marinating which leads to tastier, juicier steaks! Tenderizing also leads to quicker, more even cooking so you’ll never have to suffer a poorly cooked steak again!  
       The unique shape pattern of our blades works uniformly across the meat with ease witch makes "Crisscross" holes.
Most tenderizing blades are pointed like a knife, focusing on cutting through the meat, Our “U” shaped blades are designed to gently pierce and break up the fibrous tissues that cause that unwanted chewy consistency. 
All of this makes for a quick, efficient, and uniform tenderizing experience that leaves your steak tender, delicious, and ready for marinating or cooking.  
Our design also features protective guide pins that line the edges of the surface. These pins stick out a little further than the blades, ensuring you do not pierce too deep or stick to the surface of your cutting board. This allows the blades to remain even and sharp.  
     Our blades are hand-finished by skilled JAPANESE wood-carving knife craftsmen. 
Each blade is precisely built, one by one, to ensure the high quality you expect from Japanese artisans.
  With niXaX light, cleaning is easier than ever. Simply remove the blade cartridge from the apparatus and clean normally or place in the top rack of the dishwasher for even easier cleaning. 
  Combining over 100 years of skilled Japanese craftsmanship with our patent-pending design, the niXaX light features:
10 hand-crafted tenderizing blades  
Crisscross pattern tenderizing  
 “U” shaped blades for breaking up tissue without compromising the meat  
Protective guide pins to prevent the blades from sticking into the cutting board  
Dishwasher safe, easy to clean design  
 Our blades are hand-finished by skilled JAPANESE wood-carving knife craftsmen. Each blade is precisely built, one by one, to ensure the high quality you expect from Japanese artisans.
       YOSHIHARU CUTLERY CO. LTD., is a Japanese company which has over 100 years of history making cutlery in Seki City. We have been broadly known as the No.1 Chisel manufacturer in Japan for a long time.
The refined skill of finishing blades still lives on in the performances of our craftsmen of today. The blades of niXaX have been hand finished by our artisans one-by-one, with impeccable care.
    Altogether, over 100 years of Japanese tradition and craftsmanship go into each niXaX light, delivering the best, most affordable way to tenderize and improve your steak life!

2nd Stretch Goal Unlocked !
We did it!  Thanks to everyone who helped us reach our 2nd stretch goal!  We have now unlocked the new edition to the Cosmic Night Owl range - PURPLE MOON :

This version is now available to order from our reward tiers on the right.

The 'Super Owl Collector' reward includes all 3 Cosmic Night Owl lights (including the Purple Moon), a box of mini Cosmic Owls, the hand painted Cosmic Night Owl (Twilight) and also the Kickstarter exclusive Cosmic Rainbow Owl.
As an extra thank you for helping us reach our 2nd stretch goal, we will also include a bonus clear mini Cosmic Owl for every backer who has ordered a Cosmic Night Owl sculpture :)
*     *     *     *     *     *     *     *     *     *     *    *     *     *     *     *     *     *
£5000 Stretch goal . . .
If we reach our £5000 stretch goal we will make available a new version of the Cosmic Night Owl light.  This will be another light sculpture, but with a difference...
 The Purple Moon edition will be cast in a purple tinted bio-resin, and will be accompanied by a purple LED tea light. But it will also glow in the dark, so once the light is turned off, the blue ghost of an owl will glow through the night...
Purple Moon Edition - light on / light off
If we reach this stretch goal, we will also include a bonus clear mini Cosmic Owl for every backer who has ordered a Cosmic Night Owl sculpture :)
*     *     *     *     *     *     *     *     *    *    *    *     *     *     *     *     *     *
1st Stretch Goal Reached...
As we have reached our stretch goal of £4000, we have just released a new mini Cosmic Owl.  This sculpture stands 5cm tall, and this first edition is painted in a rainbow colour fade.  This will be available to order exclusively through this Kickstarter campaign.
Cosmic Owl - Kickstarter exclusive
*     *     *     *     *     *     *     *     *    *     *    *     *     *     *     *     *     *
My Story... 
I am an artist based in St Ives, a coastal town in Cornwall, UK.   My partner and I set up the Muju Studio here 7 years ago to focus on our own creative journey.  
Mr Muju produces drawings, paintings and prints of an imaginary dimension - Mujuworld.  I take inspiration from this world and bring the characters to life through limited edition sculptures.
We both work full time on a variety of creative projects, and have been exhibiting and selling artwork to a worldwide audience for over 10 years. You can check out more of our work at www.mujuworld.co.uk
Miss Muju sculpting the Cosmic Night Owl
About this project...
Since I was young I have always loved owls.  They feature significantly in ancient mythology and folklore, and are often associated with wisdom and good fortune.  
Although owls are mostly nocturnal, I have been lucky enough to see them in the wild, which inspired me to create some owls of my own.  
5 Muju mini Cosmic Owl Sculptures
The phenomenon of the Northern Lights captured my imagination from an early age.  This kickstarted a life long fascination with glowing lights, natural and man made... from fireflies to bioluminescent plankton, and fairy lights to candles.
I have tried to illuminate the darkness with all sorts of different glowing lights over the years, hoping to recreate some of the magic of the Aurora Borealis in my own home.  
This project brings together these too passions to create the Cosmic Night Owl.  By illuminating a clear resin sculpture with a colour changing LED light, I hope to bring the glowing Cosmic Night Owl to life.  
Having lived in many different places in my adult life, I have often found the sense of home can be created anywhere, as long as when the night closes in, you can bring a feeling of coziness with the right lighting.  
So I wanted to create a piece of art which could be enjoyed not only for how it looks, but also for the atmosphere it can create.
Why I need your help...
The costs involved in self-producing a new sculpture are high.  
 I choose to cast my sculptures in bio-resin, which is a non-toxic and more sustainable material than traditional resin (derived from sunflower seed oil instead of petroleum).  
However it's significantly more expensive than polyurethane epoxy resin. 
Bioresin also has a much slower setting time (12-24hrs), so I'll need to make multiple silicone moulds to increase my production rate.  This takes more time and financial investment.
For this project to be successful I also need to invest in some larger casting equipment to ensure each sculpture is flawless.
Project Cost breakdown:
Bulk buying bio-resin to cover production run = £700 
Silicone for multiple sculpture moulds = £250 
Large pressure pot for casting = £450
Compressor for casting = £250
LED tea lights = £100
Kickstarter fees and bank charges (~10% of pledges) = £250 
packaging and shipping costs = £500
Total needed = £2500
I need your help to raise funds in order to bring this project to life.
Pre-order sales through this Kickstarter campaign will enable me to fund a production run of this handmade light sculpture.
*     *     *     *     *     *    *     *     *    *     *     *     *     *     *     *     *     *
REWARDS...

Purple Moon Edition - light on / light off

The Cosmic Night Owl - Purple Moon edition - is cast in a purple bioresin, with purple and silver sparkles and stars encased in the resin.  
This version is not only an illuminated sculpture, but it also glows in the dark...  so once the light is turned off, the blue ghost of an owl will glow through the night.
The sculpture stands 9cm tall (3.5") and has a hollow in the base which sits over a purple LED tea light. Each sculpture comes with one waterproof LED tea light and battery.

Inspired by the Northern Lights, the Aurora version of the Cosmic Night Owl changes colour through a glowing cycle of red, green and blue. The sculpture is cast in a light blue clear bio-resin, with blue and silver sparkles encased in the resin.  These sparkles add to the magic of the sculpture when they catch the light.

COSMIC NIGHT OWL - TWILIGHT EDITION
Cosmic Night Owl - Twilight Edition

MINI COSMIC OWLS :

The £20 reward tier is for a set of 5 mini Cosmic Owl sculptures.  
You will receive one of each of the 5 designs, and every one will be a different colour.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The risks and challenges in completing this project are minimal. We have already reached the stage in production where the original sculpt is complete, and we have made the first silicone mould.

The prototype Cosmic Night Owls have been successful, so we are able to start production immediately. We are experienced in casting resin sculptures, so do not foresee any problems arising.
We also don't anticipate any problems with the supply of bio-resin, as we have already secured a supplier.

We already have 4 successful Kickstarter campaigns under our belt, and will be using all the experience we gained from our previous kickstarters to help with this project.

We have set realistic goals for the production times of the different rewards in this Kickstarter. The 2 versions of the Cosmic Night Owl lights will be open editions, but we will make them available in batches with varying delivery dates. This is to allow us time to fulfill all the reward pledges within a reasonable time frame.

We will also keep all our backers updated with the production process so they know when to expect their rewards to arrive.

We are ready to bring this project to life if you are too :)

campaign.story:
//// A N N O U N C E M E N T  - NOW AVAILABLE AT: WWW.PHOTOLIGHTCASE.COM\\\\
Instagram is so hot right now and so is ‘flatlay’ — an ordered, structured way to arrange items for photography. If you make and / or sell things online then this mini pop up photo studio will give you amazing photos using just your smart phone.
 It’s all about the images. Now that Facebook owns Instagram you can already see its going to be the next big retail marketing platform. If you’re an online seller you know you need to make your goods look as sweet as possible. Lightcase gives you professional looking images without complicated lighting setups or expensive equipment.
How? The diffusion of light. The light hitting the sides of the translucent polypropelene Lightcase diffuses the light that comes to rest on your objects. Professionals strive for this sort of evenly lit result. Using just the available ambient light, Lightcase nails it every time.
 Lightcase takes less than 30 seconds to assemble. Depending on how long you take to shoot and add your tags, your image could be live on Instagram in less than a minute. Whoah! Detailed #Flatlay set ups takes a little longer than that of course.
 In response to the feedback from the worldwide maker community about our first two Lightcases this version has no base. You can take it anywhere and pop it over any surface so the result is only limited by what you can find or what you can make to put Lightcase over. You can add an infinite backdrop for front angle shooting. 
We like making things.
We like making things better even better.

This is our third Lightcase and our third Kickstarter campaign. 
Lightcase (Released 2014) 
Our first Lightcase was made for people who wanted to be able to get professional photographic results using a smart phone and an inexpensive flat-pack, pop-up photo booth. We ran a successful Kickstarter campaign and sent 1,341 Lightcases out into the big wide world. Then we were inundated with so much positive feedback from the global maker community so we started thinking about how we could make Lightcase better. 
Lightcase Pro (Released 2015)
Using really diverse feedback from our customers who were using the original Lightcase we decided to make it 175% bigger and expandable. After another successful Kickstarter campaign we sent 1,060 Lightcase Pro to crafty, arty, photo peeps all over the globe. 
Lightcase #Flatlay (To be released 2016)
Lightcase #Flatlay is what this Kickstarter campaign is for. It’s not that it’s better than our earlier versions (we have no favourites in our family!), it’s just different. It allows for square format photos so suits Instagrammers perfectly. And with no base it can be placed over anything for infinite background options.
Dom Crinson — father, artist, designer, inventor 
Dom has always been thinking, tinkering, designing, making and, well, dreaming. Commercially he has made a name for himself in the UK interior design world with his range of ceramic tiles for high end luxury residential and commercial spaces. This has been able to fund his true passions of art and ceramics where he has also gained significant worldwide praise. 
Though at the moment he is focused on making Lightcase better. It all started because his maker partner was looking for a way to photograph her wares to sell online in places like Etsy. Lightcase grew out of trial, error, feedback and success via working with his local maker community.
There are now over 3500 Lightcases worldwide. 
You are supporting a great product that is going to revolutionize your product photography!
Please share our Kickstarter campaign and help us bring this to market by clicking on the share buttons below the video or going to www.photolightcase.com
Join us: www.facebook.com/photolightcase
Instagram: @photolightcase
Tumblr: www.photolightcase.tumblr.com
For more images and information as well as photography tips and tricks please visit the Lightcase website www.phototolightcase.com
Thank you for making this happen!
Dom and the Lightcase Creative Team

To celebrate Apple's 40th anniversary we wanted to bring something special to the world. Introducing the AP40, a wireless bluetooth controller, designed as an homage to Apple's original retro logo. It is compatible with many devices like iOS, Android, Mac and PC. Coupled with our Retro Receiver line, you can even use your AP40 on retro systems like the NES, SNES and now the Apple IIc.
Compatible with your smart devices or PC.
  Manufactured with a special focus on design and quality materials.
  The AP40 is designed with a silicon "leaf" plug for the USB port.
  The AP40 is a Bluetooth controller. Connecting it with any of your devices is a breeze. It pairs the same way that most other Bluetooth devices pair. You start by putting your controller in "Bluetooth mode" then in your devices Bluetooth setting, select the controller and it's paired. Check out the video below to see how easy it is to pair with each device.
PLAY

*For iOS devices, AP40 is compatible with iCade formatted apps only*
To honor Apple's pioneering Apple I in 1976, we designed a stand modeled after the original Apple II computer. It is designed to elegantly hold your AP40 controller, smart phone or tablet.
The AP40 stand elegantly holds your AP40 controller.
  Use the AP40 stand to hold your iPhone or Tablet. It has the perfect viewing angle to play games.
  Crafted from aluminum.
  We wanted to do something unique to celebrate the anniversary of the Apple I. We developed a Retro Receiver for the original Apple IIc. If you are familiar with our Retro Receiver line (for NES & SNES), the Retro Receiver for Apple IIc functions exactly the same. It allows you to use your AP40 wirelessly with your original Apple IIc. Not only can you play your Apple IIc wirelessly with any 8Bitdo controller or arcade stick, you can even use wireless next gen controllers (PS3, PS4, Wii Mote, Wii U Pro). 
Play games on your Apple IIc wirelessly with the AP40 controller.
  The entire set is designed as an homage to the original Apple II computer.
  Compatible with all of 8Bitdo's controllers and next gen controllers, too.
  Housed in a beautiful aluminum enclosure.
  The AP40 Limited Edition is limited to 1976 units. It includes an AP40 controller, an AP40 Stand. Everything is packaged in numbered, Limited Edition packaging modeled after an Apple Disk II floppy drive. It also includes a Certificate of Authenticity. 
Limited edition packaging.
  Each Limited Edition package is numbered 1 of 1976 units.
  When you remove the lid on the packaging, you'll see something special inside.
  Each AP40 Stand is engraved with the Limited Edition number, too.
  AP40 Controller
    AP40 Stand
Retro Receiver for Apple IIc 
              8Bitdo is committed to bringing you the best video game controllers, and accessories. Founded in 2013, we started with an idea - to bring high quality, wireless retro controllers to your smart devices. Today, we've released over 15 products, with many more in development now.

campaign.story:
For the last two years we have been filming and editing a feature-length documentary about Dennis Skinner. We have finished filming and now putting the final touches to the film. 
You can watch the film's first teaser trailer here.
We're asking for this money to pay for unavoidable post-production costs - archive images and footage, an original soundtrack, sound design and film festival entry fees. We managed to complete filming thanks to kind donations from the NUM, various union branches and members of the public, and we just need one last push to complete the documentary and get it out there.
Dennis in "The Palace of Varieties"
All our crew have volunteered their time, equipment and expertise towards making the film, but unfortunately passion and determination only get you so far in filmmaking. None of the money raised will be going to anything other than the costs of getting the film completed. We've asked for £18,000. We could do with more, as that would allow us to use more expensive archive material (BBC), but we think that's the maximum amount we can ask the public to help us raise. We will also lose up to 10% of the amount raised through various Kickstarter fees, so we have had to incorporate these costs in to the total.  
We hate to ask for this money, but unfortunately this is the only way we can see to get this film out there so the public can view it. So, if you think you would like to support our documentary, please donate any amount you can manage. We will be forever grateful!
Thank you, 
Dan and Christie. 
Dennis and his brother Graham
Here's a breakdown of where the money will be going:
£3000 - archive images from Getty, Alamy, Rex Features and Mirrorpix.
£7000 - archive footage from ITN, BBC, RT, Parliament TV and Platform Films.
£4000 - sound design.
£1250 - soundtrack.
£1750 - festival fees. 
£500 - Kickstarter gifts. 
£500 - publicity material - posters, flyers etc. 
Twitter: @DSkinnerFilm
Facebook: Dennis Skinner: Nature of The Beast
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
If we reach our target and therefore pay all licenses for the footage we use, the next step is to enter the film into festivals. Here, the film can receive some buzz and get picked up for distribution! But obviously, this is a risk. 

There is not a 100% guarantee this will happen straight away. It may well be another hard slog to get this film out there but we WILL get it out there! After two years of believing in this film enough to make it on a shoestring without compromising quality, we would never give up at this point. We believe in this film. We will make sure you get to see it.
These days there are so many options out there - self distribution, on-demand streaming, straight to DVD, small cinema releases...Not only do we believe in our documentary, you have believed enough to donate, and we don't take that lightly.

updates.update_userinfo: DVD and Film Link Rewards Exclusive!
updates.update_content:
Hello to all you lovely patient backers!
We just thought we'd update you with what has been going on the last few months since we last spoke.
The film was finished in March - hurrah! - and since then we have been busy beavers entering the film in to festivals, tying up licenses, sending out screeners to very-important-people and lots and LOTS of emails.

Happy new year, backers! 2016 was a success for our documentary, thanks to all of you, and now we're hoping 2017 will be just as fruitful.
January is set to be jam-packed with our composer busy creating original music and our sound designer working away to get the film sounding top notch. We're also colouring the film, making it look all shiny and beautiful.
Once the film is all polished and ready to go, we can begin entering the film in to festivals and start creating some 'buzz', as those-in-the-biz like to say, and see where that road takes us!

It's all done! With a huge sense of relief and amazement this morning we were able to gaze at our final total - £21,009. Absolutely brilliant. That means, minus fees, we have still come in over our target and we can use the extra cash to pay for extra things! Hurrah!
To all the backers - thank you so much for believing in us. As independent filmmakers with a political subject, we were finding it difficult to secure traditional funding. But you, Skinner fans, film fans, all you lovely helpful people stepped up and made it possible! We know you've all worked hard for that money, and the fact you parted with some of it for us, is just...wow. We are humbled, and you should be proud - you have been a huge part of making this happen!

Here we are, 9 days to go and, as I type, £207 from our target!
We are astounded. Literally. We keep just looking at each other, agog. It is overwhelming that we have come this far thanks to, in the words of Blanche DuBois, the kindness of strangers.
With 9 days left and not far to go it is looking very positive. I'll say no more in case I jinx it! But the thing is, the more we raise, the more clips of Dennis we can put in, the more images we can license and the better the film can be! To be honest, we have cut out some things because we know they have bumped up the price, but if there's any chance we can pop them back in - fantastic!

Filming in Parliament is due to begin at 8am. Today we’re filming Dennis Skinner in the House of Commons, the ornate surrounding corridors and an area called ‘St. Stephen’s Hall’. We have to be there so early as it gets much busier after 9am. Being based in Liverpool, this means a horrendously early start, or an over night stay. We choose the latter option and stay at a hostel above a pub, the night of an England football match.. We use some of the previous day to shoot some lovely footage of deer in Richmond Park, which we use in the film.

updates.update_userinfo: A Day's Filming in Parliament - 13th June 2016
updates.update_content:
It's almost a week since we launched our campaign and we've been hitting the publicity pretty hard - so much so we've mastered the perfect media-darling air kiss.
But really, we've been at it from both sides, being interviewed and interviewing people.
We managed to get interviews this week with the one and only Ken Loach when we attended a showing of the brilliant I, Daniel Blake. Down at the Labour conference we caught up with MP Richard Burgon, a brilliantly passionate speaker, and MP Ian Lavery, a close friend of Dennis. Both told us in their own words what they think of 'The Beast'. Keep a look out for those on our Facebook and Twitter, and share them with your friends, as every share and like can bring us closer to reaching our total.

As seen on:
Firebiner: Your everyday-carry survival carabiner.
We all love a good carabiner. We use them to clip our keys, our camera, our water bottle, or a myriad of other products to our backpacks, to shelves, to fences, to belt loops or to whatever we need at the moment. You want your carabiner to be strong, lightweight and maybe have some other functionality like a bottle opener.
We agree. The Firebiner is all that PLUS it has the ability to make fire easily with our patent-pending EverSpark technology. It has a titanium-coated stainless steel body construction rated for up to 50 pounds of gear (not for climbing or hanging anything with a beating heart). And, don't forget the small utility blade. We even designed in a screwdriver tip for the next round of prototypes.
Firebiner breakout
                                            Light up your life with an easy spark from our patent-pending EverSpark technology.
Utility blade can be used on fishing line, thread, paracord and whatever else you would like to sever (within reason of course).
Aaahhh, thank goodness for a handy bottle opener. Now time for some refreshment.
Clip just about anything to your pack or anywhere.
Hang slots to connect keys or whatever else your heart desires.
The right design and the right material
Very strong stainless steel construction with up to 50 lbs capacity (we will keep you updated with final testing)
Extremely durable titanium coating
Lightweight, only 1 oz
EverSpark spark wheel technology to help start fires easily
Replaceable ferro rod, with extra rods
Utility/safety blade to easily cut paracord, fishing line, string and much more - stainless steel, replaceable
Bottle opener, for refreshment time
Hang slots to connect keys or anything else with an appropriate ring or clasp
Strong, thin, stainless steel wire gate that stays closed but is easy to open when needed
Screw-driver tip to be added on next round of prototypes
Patent-pending
3 colors: Black, Gold & Blue  
The Firebiner is not a toy. Keep out of reach of small children.
Having a replaceable ferro rods means this Firebiner will keep on sparking.
The Firebiner isn't just for survival; It's for every day use. See 9 fires created in under 1 minute. We are Outdoor Element, but you have our permission to go indoors as well. The Firebiner helps create fire, so be careful and responsible (you can thank our lawyers for that one). Check it out:

      “I must have a prodigious amount of mind; it takes me as much as a week, sometimes, to make it up!”
- Mark Twain
Decisions can be tough, why not leave some to fate?
35,000 a day (Google it).  The majority are indeed made on a subconscious level, but you have to admit, some of those decisions are right at the surface nagging away.  You won't know how you lived this long without The Decision Maker.
          We will be offering five different metal options.  Brass, Bronze, Copper, Nickel Silver and .999 pure Silver.  These are all solid metals with no plating involved.  The first four options will have a patina but you will have the option of mint or aged on the .999 Silver coin.
Weight:
Brass, Bronze, Copper & Nickel Silver app. 12-13 grams
.999 Silver 1/2 Troy ounce or app. 16-17 grams
Diameter:  All coins 1.3"
                    If you want more then four of the standard coins please contact us for add on price.
Some of you may know our brand and what we are about.  The majority of our goods are machined so why are we having a coin minted?  My original concept was to manually machine a brass or copper coin and then have the original art laser etched into the coin.  I attempted this but wasn't happy.  I thought I would like the modern look of the laser etching with the manually machined feel of the coin but what you would end up with is an expensive, not so cool looking coin.  That was concept was vetoed over a year ago and I shelved the project.  A few months ago I stumbled across a campaign from Shire Post Mint and thought to myself "hmmm...I wonder if they would be interested in minting my coin idea?".  I thought long and hard before contacting Woody over at Shire Post.  Should I have the coin minted?  After many days of deliberation (without a Decision Maker coin), I decided to shoot him an email.  He was so cool and did such amazing work that I couldn't pass up the project.
Do you know how a coin is made?  It's pretty neat.  First the art is engraved into high grade die steel, then the dies are heat treated and fitted for the press.  Blanks that are cut from sheet metal are centered between the dies in the press and WHAMMO...a coin is pressed.  Shire Post Mint already has our dies made and is ready to crank out production.
         Thanks...
Lisa (always first to thank), Mike for the perfect art and Woody for all of the hard work on minting a perfect coin.

campaign.story:
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Pocket Clip Stretch Goal Skipped
I've decided to skip the stretch goal for the pocket clip and just have them made. Even if we don't meet the minimum order quantity for them, the worst that can happen is i have a bunch of clips floating around my shop. I've added the details towards the bottom of the page.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
A True Go-Anywhere Compact Pen
Whether I'm in the shop, a meeting, the car, at the store, on a golf course, it seems like I can never find anything to write with. The QDC 2.2 is the perfect size for a keychain, a purse, and even as a zipper pull.
The original QDC was discontinued in 2015 when they stopped making the G2 mini pens. Since then, I began a new design that would use a bolt action mechanism based on my first project. The bolt mechanism requires a lot of space and using a standard size refill made it way too long to be a mini-pen.
Image from refillfinder.com
 Using the Lamy M22 refill allows the pen to be more compact.
A More Robust QDC Mechanism
The complexity of the previous QDC mechanism caused some issues in some extreme cases. Originally trying to stick with the same form factor, I tried using an o-ring to hold the cap on.
Failed Prototype
This did not work out well. I lost every prototype I made. The brass cap was also very heavy on my carabiner keychain.
Canted Coil Spring
Patented in the early 1990's as an attachment device, this was a new and innovative way to connect and disconnect a cylinder in a tube. It has also been used in the connector industry, combining a shielding and latching mechanism in one simple design.
Canted Coil Spring Latching Mechanism
  QDC Latching Mechanism  
Since the first cap was so heavy, I moved the cap to the back and reversed the genders to cut down on the heavy brass material.
This Quick DisConnect is a much more robust mechanism that is simpler than the previous design, using a single Canted Coil spring to latch onto the keyring.
With a quick tug, the pen comes free from the keyring. It takes over 10 lbs for a straight pull to disconnect from the keyring, but snaps off easily when pulled off axis.
These are the main reason for the Kickstarter Project. These are special springs that are very expensive at low volumes.
Rewards
Standard Materials:
There will be 2 standard offerings: Anodized Aluminum and Raw Brass. Each of these will come with a wide-lined grip.
 Anodized Aluminum:
Anodized Aluminum
 Machined Brass:
Machined Brass
Custom QDC Materials and Grips
I will also manually machine a limited amount of personalized pens as well. Materials will be aluminum, brass, and copper. Grips will also be customizable with options like: wide lines, thin lines, knurling, or no grip at all.
Pen Specifications:
Overall Size:
 Refill:
Lamy M22 in Black or Blue
Pocket Clips 
Stamped from spring steel and powdercoated black, the pocket clips snap onto the body of the pen.
The cost for the pocket clip is $2 each, and that can be added onto your pledge now, or when you do the survey through Backerkit. They will not come on the pens, but are simple to snap on.
Timeline
Stretch Goals 
$12,000 - Pocket Clip - A pocket clip that will snap onto the back of the pen.
$20,000 - Copper Material as a Standard - With the wide lined grip, copper QDCs will be offered as a non-custom pen.
campaign.risks:

The greatest risk is timing. I have a good relationship with the Machine House as well as with the Anodizer vendors, so those should go smoothly. Assembly is simple and once all components are received, shipping will follow shortly after.

This project will be run just like the original QDC mini-pen. We exceeded delivery times and all went smoothly.

Have you ever tasted something so delicious and amazing that you wanted to share with the world?  Does Japanese Beef really have all the hype people swear it does?  Is NatesJerky really as good as people say it is?
  Yes..Yes..and more Yes!
  Akaushi Steak
  At NatesJerky we are continuously trying new ideas, new products, new flavors and this time around our R&D has taken on this daring project to bring you this delightful, buttery and tender breed of Akaushi Beef (aka Kobe Red) in its most delicious jerky snack form.
Kobe beef is referred to as a breed of Wagyu(Japanese Cow) that originated from the Kobe region of Japan.  Akaushi(Red Cow) is one of the four breeds of cattle that were from this region of Japan.  Akaushi is specifically known for its intense marbling and delicious flavor.  Our vendors have secured us availability of meat for this project and we need your help to make it a reality!
Of the four Japanese breeds of cattle, Akaushi is the one known in its native Japan as the “Emperor’s Breed.”  The faster marbling is a signature trait of Akaushi genetics, which means the cattle place fat inside the muscle not on the outside. That means less waste. The Japanese Association of Akaushi has kept detailed data on every Akaushi for the last nine decades even.
This is what our Vendor has to say about the benefits of this breed...
Akaushi Beef's extraordinary health benefits stem from two features:
Higher concentration of monounsaturated fat relative to saturated fat.  The American Heart Association notes this can lead to lower cholesterol, the prevention of coronary heart disease and weight loss.
Natural source of oleic acid, the compound found in olive oil that the USDA touts as good for the heart.  Oleic acid is what gives this beef its unique buttery taste.
We realize that other campaigns have attempted similar in the past and failed.  They are not us and if you can help us reach our goal, we can show You and the World what's so special about this Beef, this Brand and our Business!
