campaign.story:
The New Mark II Handmade Everlasting Mechanical Pencil
Firstly, If you liked the video please share this project with your friends to help us get the word out there :) The share buttons are just under the video section. Thank you!
Where it began  
My Grandfather Philip Hemingway was an engineer and draftsman in his early career. Later he retired to become an Horologist (Clockmaker). Pencils like this one were not around when he was a draftsman, but neither were pencils seen as disposable, valueless tools. 
The disposable culture we live in today encourages a valueless attitude to cheap material things. It is these cheap products that really cause a lot of the world's pollution. Because of their large scale production they cost next to nothing. This not only makes them attractive to buy to the masses, but also produces a disposable and valueless mindset towards them and so many are thrown away without consideration for their real value and cost to the environment. 
I have a box that belonged to my grandfather of all of his tools and some of the pencils inside it have been sharpened all the way down to the rubber, in fact, I have a box of drafting tools from his grandfather William Hemingway too in which lies another almost fully sharpened down pencil which must be well over 100 years old. 
How often nowadays do you see the design life of a pencil lasting over 1 year? Of course they can last many years, but the point is, do we see a value in the pencil any more?
My Great Great Grandfather's drafting set.
     This led to the Everlasting Mechanical Pencil Mark I
...This ultimately then led to the Mark II Everlasting Mechanical Pencil below...
The Mark II Handmade Everlasting Mechanical Pencil
We thought what better way to launch our new pencil, than on the platform that created us. Those of you who made us what we are today through Kickstarter have the chance to own our new and latest mechanical pencil.
        With a diameter of only 8mm, they are beautifully slim.
  Unscrewing of the nib reveals its brass mechanism
  Our Pledge Rewards mean you not only get your hands on these pencils first, but you also get a considerable discount too!
Reward 1 (pledging £49): Gives you 30% off the future RRP. 
Reward 2 (pledging £54): Gives you 22% off the future RRP.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Of course there is a small chance that there may be delays in the process, but I hope to absolutely meet my deadlines and fulfillment agendas once the pledge target is met. Realistically, there are no real obstacles to overcome as I am machining all the units myself and have estimated that I can produce a maximum of 20 pencils per day absolutely all on my own. That's the great thing about a self producing production line, I am not relying on any other companies or manufacturers to meet my demands. 
If I get an order for 40 of my precision pencils then I make 40 pencils and distribute them myself with no one else to depend upon. This bespoke made to order service is the way small business used to run before industrialisation. It's a straightforward service much like a tailors. Its a beautifully simple means of production and so I hope not to run into any problems.

A Backpack created for the modern everyday life - With hidden zippers, to outsmart the thieves. Designed to support your back. Easy to access pockets and a revolutionary material.
We are a team who are passionate about creating great products. One day, we realized that the bags we were using everyday, had a lot of problems. So we decided to to something about it, simply to get a better bag for our everyday life. A year later, we had an amazing design for, what we think is an amazing bag.
Over 400.000 Thefts are comitted every day around the world, so we designed the Berg Backpack to solve this. 
We designed a hidden zipper, that is located up against you back. So no thieves will have access to your valuable stuff.
The Berg Backpack hugs your back, making it feel very naturally on your back. This design will distribute the weight evenly and reduce back pains. 
We placed the laptop compartment up against your back, so it feels dramatically lighter. It also improves your posture when walking and running.
One back pocket for the passport, cash or wallet.
 Side pocket for the phone, wallet or metrocard.
 Strap pocket for creditcard, metro card or a smaller smartphone. (Only available after we reach the stretch goal)!
 The revolutionary material on the Berg backpack is amazingly durable and strong. We have tried with super sharp knives and really put some weight in, but have not been able to cut through the material. 
 The oxford material is water repellent, and we have tested this ourselves. 
WSRS Waterproof rating system, we have found that it is Class 2. 
 We are a small but very dedicated team, trying to create the best product that we can. For many many months now, we have been working on this and we hope that you will like it. 
Our design mantra is simplicity, and this is very visible in the Berg Backpack. Nothing other than what needs to be there, is included in the design. 
We went through a lot of prototyping to come up with the right design. We started with the drawing and thinking process - then we contacted the manufacturer, to produce the first prototypes. We got the first ones, but they was not working, as we wanted. So we went back to the drawing board and took some more time before ordering more prototypes. We then went back after a few weeks, and now with a clear idea of how it should be. And shortly after, we received the final Berg Backpack.
campaign.risks:

We designed the Berg Backpack from the sketches on a paper, so we feel that we know the backpack and the quality that we are producing it in. 

We work with a manufacturer in China, that has many years of experience in producing travel and everyday bags. They know how to make bags and therefore has a realistic timeline for the production of the Berg Backpack. 

The challenge therefore will not be the production side, but mostly the fulfillment side. Because we offer worldwide shipping, we can have some delays to people living in places where the shipment infrastructure is not easy. But we will get it to you! We are partnering with Shipwire to make sure that most people gets the bag at the promised time.

So in short, there is nothing to worry about.

campaign.story:
Hello Kickstarters, welcome to my 2nd project. I am super excited to be launching a CNC machined pen I call the SQ1. Machined from 6061 Anodized Aluminum, with Brass and Copper Options. Please take a moment  and read about the SQ1 EDC PEN, if you like what you see be sure to check out the different reward packages I have created. -Ryan
Which is your favorite? I can't decide either :) Pick A few!
Design:
Funny how when you use an everyday item like a pen, you really don't take much notice to it. Think about it? When was the last time you really picked up a pen and gave it a thorough inspection? Most of us just grab anything write something down then throw it back down on the table. After designing and manufacturing my first pen project, I have a tremendous amount of respect for this every day item.
I wanted to create a pen that stood out from the crowd, which doesn't mean it needed to be the craziest out of this world design using some un-obtanium material. Trust me I love exotic materials like titanium just as much as the next guy. Unfortunately titanium is crazy expensive, which in the end drives the price up for the consumer. I personally feel that a pen should be something simplistic and functional with a certain cool factor. 
Inspiration and Influences:
As a young man, I can recall watching my dad spend hours in his shop building the coolest cars. We would take them to car shows and people would always ask "Hey Who Built that Car" and I could always see the sense of pride on my dads face when he replied "I did". One thing that always stuck out to me. Everything my dad did was complicated, but if you sat back and looked at it, you couldn't really tell. That was his secret, keep it simple. My style and designs are greatly influenced by all the imagery I was exposed to growing up and I feel the SQ1 represents that. 
The SQ1 Features and Construction:
Deconstructed SQ1
Main Body: 
6061 T6 Aluminum Anodized in Various Colors, With a Dimple Pattern Milled onto the writing end for the perfect grip.
The Main Pen Body is CNC Machined using a 60* Single Point Threading Tool. Once the threading operation is complete, the pen tube is transferred over to the CNC Milling Machine and loaded into a 4th Axis Machine. This is where I machine the dimples into the pen tube. I experimented with different size dimples and various depths. The final version is a perfect combination of the two. You can grip the pen comfortably without any discomfort. This is by far my favorite feature of this pen.
                               PLAY

 Fisher Space Pen Fine Refill
Fisher Space Pen Refill
Again keeping things simple, I chose one of the most popular and affordable pen refills on the market. One thing I disliked about allot of custom pens was the annoying O-Rings and Spacers needed. I machined the SQ1 Pen Tip specifically around the Space Pen Refill. This pen will not need a spacer on the back end or those tiny obscure sized o-rings which always get lost. Instead I have a Machined tip that matches the Space Pen Tip Profile. You will also notice I created a Set Screw Setup. Simply drop the Space Pen Refill inside the pen tube, then insert the 1/8 set screw and snug it up against the pen. No loose rattling refill as well AWESOME!
1/8" Set Screw Secures Pen Refill. No Spacers Required, No Loose Refills.
  Insert Space Pen, Insert 1/8 Allen, Insert Stylus - No Spacers - No O-Rings
                            CAP OPTIONS:
Polished Copper
Polished Brass
Forced Copper Patina ($10.00 ADD ON)
Brushed Patina ($10.00  ADD ON)
Dark Patina, Polished Brass, Polished Copper, Forced Copper Patina
  Copper Forced Patina on Satin Black
  Brushed Copper Patina on Satin Red
  Polished Brass / Polished Copper
STYLUS:
I have to be honest here, when I first designed this pen, my wife said "You should put a stylus on the pen". Like most men I just said "No" without really even thinking about it and went back to looking on my phone and that's when I realized how many hours of the day we spend on our smart phones. I did a little research and ordered some various tips and began testing and prototyping. I finally found a replaceable stylus in the size, shape and color which appealed to me. After prototyping and testing I absolutely fell in love with the stylus tip, and can't thank my wife enough for her brilliant idea. I am fortunate enough to live in Sunny Southern California. So for those who live through cold winters and often times find themselves wearing gloves, now you can break out the SQ1 and use any smart phone or tablet without having to take you gloves off!
Machined/Threaded Stylus Adapter with Replaceable Tips
 FeedBack:
As I mentioned before this is my 2nd Kickstarter Project. Take a look at some of the feedback from my first project. The EDC Bullet Lanyard Bead! This community rocks and the support and feedback makes my day!

 Shout Outs!!!
@Tacticalkeychains
Brad has been around the Kickstarter Community for years, not only as a popular creator, but an avid backer. This pen project truly would not have come to life without some encouraging words and solid advice from Brad. Since this was my first venture into the world of pens, I wanted to create a pen that was simple, affordable, worked well and most of all, STOOD OUT FROM THE CROWD! you can definitely see some of my design inspiration in the SQ1. Thanks again for the help Brad, I am really proud of this pen. This pen turned out just as I had pictured it in my head 4 months ago!
George Steinheimer
Sometimes it's easy to forget where you came from. I always try to stay humble in everything I do. I am a very competitive person and passionate about the things I do. Lucky for me, I met George when I purchased my first CNC lathe. George has been in the machining industry for over 30 years and has been an invaluable resource, mentor and friend of mine. Pressing the green button on the CNC machine is the easy part, it's the path we take to get there that most don't see. I just wanted to say thank you George for all the help you have given me, I wouldn't be making the things I create in my head without your help!

campaign.story:
I'm a maker, and my work space requires 10+ tools be within reach at all times. Instead of dumping them into a drawer, I keep my favorite tools in corrugated containers on my work desk. And this one looks like a shipping container. Assembled product measures 7in wide by 4.5in tall and 3.75in deep.
The corrugated edges of the container provide a visible storage system for pens, markers, blades, paperclips, and anything else that threatens a clean work space. The sturdy walls keep even heavy tools upright and grab-able.
Desktop Shipping Container Organizer
The printed surface of the container is created from a photograph I took of a real shipping container I found behind my Whole Foods. It is the same print used for my shipping container coffee table, which you might have seen on Gizmodo, or embellished your street name upon in an art gallery.
Blue and Orange Desktop Shipping Containers
Shipping Container Coffee Table
Shipping Container Coffee Table at 1AM SF Gallery
To assemble, the printed plastic sheet is cut and scored. I do this myself. Just four bolts are required to hold the container together. The containers will ship flat, and backers will need to set the bolts in place. Then you're ready to get back to work in an organized work area with the ambiance of a busying shipping port.
The first container replica I produced out of plastic was this booth prop for Freight Farms in Boston in 2015.
Freight Farms replica container

campaign.story:
Fire Water AEGIS
AEGIS Components and Uses
This unique survival kit provides several needed tools in order to survive. This kit will not expire like several others. 
Each AEGIS weighs 3.6 to 4.0 ounces. Lightweight and compact for everyday carry.  Wrapped in 12 feet of 7 strand US made 550 paracord.
Please check out the pictures below for further description and details of the individual components included in every AEGIS:
 Water Purification: 75 ML collapsible stainless steel cup (4 inch stainless wire holder included w/cup).
  Fire Starting Kit: magnesium ferrocerium fire starter, hack saw blade striker/scraper, 8 inches jute twine (tinder) and 1 foot nylon cord (lanyard). All Made in USA
Cutting Tool: single edge razor blade (secondary striker for fire starter). Made in USA
 Fishing Kit: 12 feet 8lb. test fishing line, #6 and #4 bait hooks, cork (pre drilled), 2 re-usable fishing line weights. All Made in USA
 Waterproof Instructions: Printed instructions on a coffee filter, all waterproof ink. Provides directions for fire starting and kit uses. Made in USA
  Cordage and Wire: 12 feet 7 strand 550 paracord (wrapping for kit), 2 feet 22 gauge stainless steel wire (for hanging cup, trapping, general use). All Made in USA
Colors Available:
Black AEGIS Survival Kit
  Desert Camo AEGIS
Digital Camo AEGIS
Our Story 
In 2013 I developed an idea for a small pocket sized survival kit. Originally my thought was to go down the same path as many and do the altoid tin survival kit. I didn’t agree with the entire concept and hated the idea of having a kit that had water purification tablets that would expire in a few years. After searching and seeing some impressive kits I decided it would be best to keep things simple and just purify water the best way I know, boil it! I have developed a few different kits over the past two years comparable to the AEGIS.  During that time period I sought all advise I could from my customers. It took time and testing to get all the components and pieces dialed in to provide the best quality survival kit I could create.
Testing one of our stainless collapsible cups, boiling water repeatedly over a fire.
PLAY

Our kits are made in my home shop, with continued support from family and friends.  This has become a true family adventure which we have embraced and enjoyed the experience thus far.  Our intention is to continue creating handcrafted survival kits and always provide our supporters with the best possible product we can. 
Magnesium Ferrocerium fire starters after being machined and drilled.
AEGIS Concept and Process  
The AEGIS will never expire and will always perform properly.  I have taken exhaustive efforts to find the best possible components for this kit. All of the tools (components) are US made material with the exception of the collapsible cup. The fire-starter (Magnesium & Ferro) is purchased stock from a US manufacture that has military contracts and a proven track record. All cordage, fishing equipment, razor, hacksaw blade, stainless steel wire and even the coffee filter are US made products. I have tested this kit over and over and it will always get the job done. The cup will work for repeated use to boil water as needed. The fire starter will operate over the course of several fires and will operate for hundreds of strikes. Once the materials are purchased all of the machine work and handcrafting is performed from my home shop in Monroe Georgia. My family assists with some of the coordination and tasks of getting all the equipment ready to be loaded into the cup. Once the fire-starters are machined and pressed into the magnesium handle, we move onto loading the kits themselves. All these items are placed into the cup in a certain order so they fit appropriately and do not come flying out when you need these tools to work for you! After the initial load a quality check is performed to ensure that all needed equipment is in the cup prior to sealing the cup with tape. After the equipment is loaded I wrap each individual kit in the seven strand para-cord. Each kit takes around twelve feet of cord to wrap. Once it is wrapped the kit is ready for use, if the kit is unwrapped it is not possible to re-wrap with the same cord due to the length needed to start the knot. This is important so you will always know that if the kit is still wrapped it is in proper working order and will provide the needed equipment if you ever need it. Thank you for taking the time to look at my product. Please continue to enjoy the great outdoors, remember to take the time to teach our children, family and friends the importance of respecting Mother Nature.

Love this page! -- Bonus page I promised from the next issue: The Chasing Arrows Issue #0.
The Chasing Arrows story explores a future where earth has flooded and floating garbage patches, known as middens, cover the seas. The story will follow two main characters, Inara and Onas.
Both Inara and Onas are Chasing Arrows, people who scavenge the middens and lead lives of thrift. To be a Chasing Arrow is to follow the Old Codes and The Way of the Arrow. To be a Chasing Arrow is to find use for the useless, to readdress the value of things, and to indeed find trash to be treasure.
Inara and Onas are orphans who live on Kaisei Atoll, a floating island of scrap located in the Trash Belt Doldrums. Onas spends his days diving for scrap on the middens while Inara works as an engineer in the Underbelly of the atoll.
Onas
Inara
I started writing The Chasing Arrows in prose. As I was writing it I realized I was spending huge amounts of time world building and writing long winded descriptions (two things that can get a novel writer in trouble). I wanted the story to have really cool magic system too. What I came up with was a system based on color. With all this in mind I realized a graphic novel would work great for this story and give me an excuse to do all the really fun novelty things behind making a story world (writing these long descriptions now as a script for my illustrator [I'm pretty sure I drive him crazy], making maps, drawing character sheets, seeing my characters come to life on the page, actually seeing the color of the magic system, and just in general being able to address the novelty book aspect with the story). I'm the kind of person who thinks the backmatter in a comic book is so frikkin' awesome.
I also think the health of our planet is important! As should we all! My characters fight for this, as I do, and as all the real Chasing Arrows of this world do!
The Chasing Arrows is an ongoing story. The first story arc will most likely be 8 issues.
The Trash Belt: Made up of floating islands of trash known as middens. The middens circle the Tear in never ending drift. The Trash Belt is modeled after real life trash gyres.
The Tear: Asteroid-like landmass jutting from the sea. The Tear flooded the world long ago (this time was known as The Weeping). The Tear is about twice the size of Mount Everest to give an idea of scale. The Tear is at the center of the Inner Circle. The Inner Circle is the densest area of the Trash Belt. Earthquake-like atmosphere (midden-mass constantly shifting). Electrical storms. Serpents. Untraveled by humans.
The Himalayan Islands: Some of the last remaining area of dry land. Also known as the Mainland or Roof of the World. The Crescent Empire and other rich noble houses reside here.
Kaisei Atoll: Floating island made up of scrap and old boats from the Time Before. Located in the Trash Belt Doldrums. Inara and Onas live here. The Underbelly is the underwater area of the atoll.
The Kelp Islands: Islands consisting entirely of mutated kelp. Ever shifting tides here. Rumored to be slave islands controlled by the Crescent Empire.
The Coral City: Mutated Great Barrier Reef. Now jutting five hundred feet above sea surface. Inhabited by humans?

campaign.story:
Many of you know my music, but did you also know I moonlight as a girl detective?
Yes, as a feminist, I have a little trouble with the term “girl detective” too—but it has a ring to it that “empowered woman investigator” just doesn’t. The award-winning lyricist in me can’t object to that.
Kitty Curran and Larissa Zageris (who head up the lady co-Watson division of my squad) need your help! They have chronicled one of my favorite detective adventures in their first graphic novella, Taylor Swift: Girl Detective and The Secrets of The Starbucks Lovers.
This gorgeously illustrated tale depicts the hilarious (and high fashion) hijinks that ensue when my colleague in crushing it, Lorde, and I take on the case of a struggling actress receiving threatening messages on her skinny mochas. Set against the glamorous backdrop of New York City (and even Brooklyn) there is no shortage of intrigue, love interests, sisterhood, and Starbucks jokes in this slim, attractive volume.
Which is why Kitty and Larissa need you to help them fund its publication by contributing to this clue.
Did I say clue?
I meant Kickstarter.
Sorry, I just came back from solving The Case of the Jellybean Ruby and writing a single about it for my next album with Lorde. I'm torn between calling it "Meddling Kids" or simply "Lorde and Taylor."
While I decide, you follow your heart... right on over to the pledge button. And, since donating is worthy of a catchy hit pop song and an accompanying Vevo-record-shattering music video, check out the different rewards you can receive for backing at different levels, too.
Now I'm off to Cape Cod to solve a mystery in a "haunted" beach mansion. I bet you all my "Bad Blood" money the only thing haunting that place is a broke heiress's even broker half-brother. You know how these things go.
Thank you for your support! We're nothing without our fans and our fans are nothing without YOU.
Love,
Your favorite Pop Star/Girl Detective
P.S. Follow my further adventures on the Taylor Swift: Girl Detective tumblr!
P.P.S. Kitty and Larissa would like to make clear that this has not been endorsed by either Taylor Swift or Starbucks in any way. You know chroniclers, they're the nervous types. It's why I never take them on adventures.
Book Excerpt
Here's the sneakiest of sneak peeks of Taylor Swift: Girl Detective and The Secrets of The Starbucks Lovers—straight from my case files:
Reward Levels
Because when someone helps you crack a case, it is important to make it worth their while. Investigate what you could get by pledging... 
By pledging the respectable sum of $5, you will receive a charmingly high-tech PDF of the book. PDFs are truly the modern-day equivalent of scooby snacks for the discerning Spunky Pet of a Meddling Kid.
Meddling Kids who pledge $15 will receive a PDF of the book as well as a physical copy of the book. Real books are excellent for reading while wearing something stylish in public, as well as for storing folded-up pages of handwritten lyrics, polaroid photographs, and clearly forged wills.
UPDATE: The Meddling Kid level is now available in a 2 and 3 book version! Now you can receive multiple copies of the book—perfect for giving to a suspect to distract them while you rifle through their handbag.
Junior Detectives pledging $20 will not only receive a PDF and physical copy of the book, but a set of 5 of postcards illustrated with scenes from The Secrets of the Starbucks Lovers as well. 
These postcards are most ideal for covertly taking down license plate numbers, or dropping a line to your gentleman friend who is always off at college when you are having adventures.
UPDATE: The Junior Detective level is now available in a 2 and 3 book reward version! Receive the postcards, plus multiple copies of the book to send to your gentleman friend so he doesn't get too lonely while you are off solving mysteries.
Backers at the Gumshoe level will enjoy a PDF and physical copy of the book, set of postcards, and three limited-edition stickers featuring intrigue, pop stardom, and the stiffest of skinny caramel lattes. 
These vinyl stickers are tough enough to take on anything life throws at them—just like you.
UPDATE: The Gumshoe level is now available in a 2 and 3 book reward version! Receive the postcards, stickers, plus multiple copies of the book. Feel free to leave a copy on the desk of the local grizzled police chief, with a wry note about how they could do with some pointers now you've cracked the case.
Top Sleuths need something attractive to pin to their evidence boards to offset all their hard-won clues and hunches. Backers at this level will find just the ticket: a full-color art print of The Secrets of the Starbucks Lovers cover. 
Easy, Top Sleuth! You’ll also receive your PDF, physical copy of the book, sticker set, and postcards. You have a hard time keeping your passion in line, maverick—but that passion is just what this job needs.
UPDATE: The Top Sleuth level is now available in a 2 and 3 book reward version! Receive the postcards, stickers, print, plus multiple copies of the book. Keep a copy for yourself, and then give one to your estranged sister as a conciliatory gift. You know it's been a long time, and you parted on bad terms... but they are the only one you can trust.
You’re not a cop.
You’re an Ace Detective. 
Throw your PDF, physical copy of the book, postcards, stickers, and art print in your limited-edition Taylor Swift: Girl Detective crest tote. 
Great for hauling around evidence and clues, it also accessorizes perfectly with your haunted, world-weary air.*
*Sexual tension with brooding, chip-on-his-shoulder partner not included.
UPDATE: The Ace Detective level is now available in a 2 and 3 book reward version! Receive the postcards, stickers, print, and tote bag, plus multiple copies of the book. You can use them to start a book club at the precinct to distract yourselves from all the grizzly cases you are investigating.
Into each generation, a slayer is born. 
You are not that slayer. 
You are a Girl Detective—which, let’s face it, is better. You make your own hours, you wear better clothes, and the potential for your love interests is only eclipsed by the potential for your #squadgoals. Backers at this level will receive the full run of goodies, plus an exclusive piece of original digital art made just for you by the illustrator of all my capers, Kitty Curran.
Choose any art style, and any subject, with a maximum of two figures in the image. Artwork will be made to your dimensions of choice and emailed to you with a small file for sharing on social media and a large high quality file should you wish to print.

campaign.story:
Have you ever bent or broken a key trying to open a paint can or attempted to repair something with whatever you have in your pocket? Have you ever needed a screwdriver NOW, but they’re all out in the garage or needed to quickly measure something at the hardware store?
Kiki: the ideal addition to your key ring
Kiki is designed to ride along side your keys, to be with you at all times and ready when you need it most. Like your wallet and your phone, your keys are always with you - the perfect place to keep a tough, well-made, multi-function tool. Laser cut from 3mm thick 304 Stainless Steel or Titanium, Kiki is tough, tailored & versatile. 
While Kiki was born to live on your key chain, it's equally at home as a zipper pull or tethered to your backpack, bag or outdoor gear.
Kiki + Leather!
Kiki can be used 'lean' like the rest of your keys, or 'dressed up' with the included hand-crafted leather sheath. It adds order to your keys, is warm to the touch and really ups the look & feel of your EDC game.
Specs 
Kiki is the result of all of the feedback we've received since our original Tuls project, incorporating the most popular mix of individual tools and backer suggestions. Whether you’re a cyclist, a backpacker, a craftsman or simply want to be ready for anything that may come up – Kiki is ready for you. 
Traveling? 
Kiki is under the 7" length restriction for tools allowed in carry-ons – we checked, you’re good to go! 
http://www.tsa.gov/traveler-information/prohibited-items 
Project
Our original Tuls was a huge success and continues to be one of our most popular products. Since then, we've gotten many requests from you for new additions and features; it's the perfect time to grow the Tuls family! The shops we are working with are the original manufacturing team from the first Tuls project, they do EXCELLENT work and stand by what they produce.
Schedule
Though the complete delivery schedule will depend on how many we actually produce for this project, we're fairly confident that we will be able to begin the shipping process in June. There are 3 separate stages to the production process and we have several back up resources if we need them, but we are posting a July ship date to be on the conservative side. It gives us some room to correct any issues that may arise.  
We've gotten pretty good at estimating production schedules - all 9 of our previous projects have shipped on time!
Shipping
We've had a very high success rate with USPS on our past projects - it's both affordable and reliable, but please note that we will not be able to track past the US border. We are happy to make alternative shipping arrangements with tracking at additional cost if needed – just let us know.

campaign.story:
Using durable high-grade silicone, we’ve created a minimalistic water bottle that rolls up and stores into a quarter of its actual size – not to mention the sturdy paracord and firestarter that make the MWB a complete survival tool. 
Roll it up and go
We've used a lot of different water bottles, and the design and functions of each create a unique experience. While keeping away from some designs, others inspired us (like the Platypus hydration pack, Bubi, and S'well). We wanted to create a bottle that stood for nothing more than the essentials in its design, and we feel we've done just that. The bottle's durable body bends and fits pretty much anywhere, while the rugged firestarter gets the flame going. The 8ft of strong paracord let the MWB meet all your nature needs. 
PLAY

Handling it all. Only skimming the possibilities of what the MWB can do!
We saw a gap in water bottles while searching for the right one. We can’t stand not having water around... I’m sure you feel the same, you little fish you. We didn’t like the bulky plastic water bottles because, well, they were too darn bulky and in the way, plus they'd crack if they had a good tumble. We didn’t like the metals because they make so much noise when in contact with keys or zippers from your bag, plus they stay dented forever. We did not like the water bladder bags because handling them with water feels odd and unstable… Finally, we didn't like that the water bottle was only about water; why not add something more? We were just unsatisfied with what was available. So, we took to the white boards and came to the MWB. 
 We travel a lot and are outdoors at every chance we get. Packing for such things should be an easy task, but often can turn into a complicated and indecisive one. We feel things now-a-days are made too complicated and/or with too many pieces to complete them. We love to see things made thoughtfully and tactfully. 
Attaching it to yourself or gear is as easy as skipping on one foot while spinning two basketballs on your pointer finger while barking like a seal ...Jk, it's really, really easy.
Spark up your flames.
While designing the MWB, we wanted a feature piece that would make our bottle distinguishable from anything out there. So, we put our efforts into the attachment piece. We wanted it to compliment the person holding the bottle, its environment, and of course the bottle itself. We have three Words for you: Paracord & Flint (Yes were considering the ampersand a word… debatable indeed!). All together creating the most foundational elements known and needed for humans everywhere; water and fire. 
LETS TALK WASTE: In the U.S alone, more than 60 million plastic bottles end up in landfills and incinerators every day. Just last year, plastic bottles total'd to 22 billion! And even though a lot of us do our very best by standing in front of the waste units deciding on what darn color and shape of hole correlates to recycling (yeah it gets confusing), it’s still not enough. At least 80% of these plastics end up in our landfills, streets, parks and beaches.  
We can help decrease this number considerably. We have created a useful and handy water bottle better than anything out there that empowers you to go anywhere and do anything. So please join us in making our goal a reality. Lets try changing this for the better.
Click above to check out the MTC, our first Kickstarter campaign!
       We want to thank you for checking out our campaign, and hope you consider supporting our project! If you do support, your funds will go toward producing the MWB, distributing it around the world, and creating a Minimal Design Company community. We want your feedback so that we can collaboratively create projects that will make life a little easier without using too much material. 
Follow us on Instagram! Click the above image to check it out!

FREE BONUS: A NEW POSTER! As a special thanks for making this campaign such a success, all our backers at the $20 level and up are getting a new bonus poster as a free gift! Pledge for the regular poster at the $25 level (or any other level) and get the orange Helvetica "Mad Men" poster free. More details here.
Ten years ago this month, I began filming what I called "my geeky side project": a documentary about typography and graphic design called Helvetica. I'd never made a film before, but I really wanted to watch a documentary about fonts and the people who make and use them. I couldn't find one, so I decided to make that film myself. What I discovered was there were a lot of people out there who also wanted to watch that kind of movie!
Just before the film was released in 2007, I asked Dutch design team Experimental Jetset, who were featured in the film, to design a poster for it. They came up with the iconic "Meet the Cast" design.
The original Helvetica poster at the 2007 World Premiere at SxSW
We sold the original run of posters from the film's website and on the road at screenings. But by 2009, when my second film, Objectified, was released, we'd run out of stock, and since our attention was on the new film (and its lovely poster designed by Build) we never reprinted it. For the past seven years people have been asking when we'd bring the Helvetica poster back. So that's the beauty of Kickstarter, if enough of you want one of these posters, we'll do the reprint!
The full-sized poster, and A2 letterpress print
The poster is 27" x 39" and will be offset printed here in New York, in black and vibrant Pantone 032 red ink on nice thick poster stock with a matte coating. We're also going to make a really nice letterpressed version of the design, in a slightly smaller A2 size (16.5" x 23"). These will be a numbered limited-edition of 200 prints, printed on Cranes Lettra 300gsm art paper by our friends at Coeur Noir Letterpress in Brooklyn.
Vintage Helvetica metal type!
As an extra reward with the letterpress print, you'll get an actual piece of vintage Helvetica metal type. We've got about 100 pieces of 1960's era type in various lower case letters and numbers. We can't take requests for specific letters on these, ya get what ya get. 
And as a special thanks for all the support, we've added two bonus gifts for all our backers at the $20 level and up. You'll get a set of love/hate Helvetica buttons, and one of the Helvetica "Mad Men" posters free!
Join us and help bring this cool and rare poster back into print.
Cheers! 
P.S. - The song in the video is from our old friends El Ten Eleven, it's called "Thinking Loudly". It's the opening track in Helvetica. 
P.P.S. - Thanks to Aaron Draplin for the hat!

campaign.story:
NEW STRETCH GOAL: If we hit $60,000, we will also release an entirely different version of "Tex Montana Will Survive!" filled with alternate jokes and deleted scenes! We had simply too much comedy to fit into one movie! This will be released via Creative Commons, exactly the same way as the "real" movie, about 2 weeks after the initial movie's release. This will also be included on the DVD/BluRay discs, as the greatest special feature we could possibly include! It's TWO movies released to the entire world in only a matter of weeks.
HELP US CHANGE THE DISTRIBUTION GAME
We made a film. It’s a feature. It’s funny. And it’s finished. Please watch our official trailer below:
Again, "Tex Montana Will Survive!" is finished... And now we want to release it. As soon as this campaign ends. To everyone. Everywhere. All over the world.
All on the same day. All at the same time. For free. Forever and ever and ever, amen.
BUT—We need your help…
ABOUT THE FILM
When his reputation as the most famous and trusted TV survival host in the world is tarnished following allegations that his show is staged, Tex Montana attempts to clear his name by documenting himself surviving in the remote wilderness for thirty days, completely alone.

82 minutes  |  unrated (contains graphic language)

 OUR GOAL
If our campaign is successful, we will erase the slow, staggered process typically necessary to bring a film to a worldwide audience, by releasing Tex Montana digitally (YouTube, Vimeo, download, torrent, etc.) via a creative commons license, in every territory, for free, almost immediately.

That means anyone, anywhere in the world, will be able to do just about anything they want with the movie. Examples include:  

Watch it! 
Re-watch it! 
Stubbornly refuse to watch it! 
Share it! 
Screen it at a quinceanera! (Or any other milestone celebration!)  
Re-edit it into an even better film! 
Burn it onto DVDs and BluRays (we’ll even supply printable artwork!) and give them to people who don’t know how to play videos on the interwebs! 
ALL KIDDING ASIDE
This campaign is in part an effort to address the countless messages we received from amazing film fans across the globe, who were understandably frustrated with how long it took for our previous film, The Battery, to be made available in their countries.

It is also a reaction, to a very sobering—and demoralizing—reality we were made painfully aware of by the end of The Battery’s incredible journey:

It is incredibly difficult to make a living as an independent filmmaker.

A dramatic influx of films on the market—coupled with the rise of peer-to-peer sharing through torrent sites—has resulted in a drastic decrease in compensation for filmmakers across the board. Minimum Guarantees (MGs) are small and residuals trickle in over the course of years.

Our hope is that by taking a risk and eschewing the conventional distribution process, the result for both filmmaker and film fan will be mutually beneficial. Contributors will receive an immediate return on their generosity; and by cutting out the middlemen, we will see a higher return on our film in a much shorter time frame.

Because the film will be released without any restrictions, your contributions today will unlock the film for all to enjoy for all of eternity.

As a result of this campaign, we would be afforded something we were never able to achieve throughout the long release of our first film: Stability. Even a small window of which would allow us to step away from our day jobs long enough to get back to doing what we truly love. Making movies.

There’s no way around it, asking for your direct support is uncomfortable and intensely humbling.

The decision to try and release a film on our own is daunting, and frankly quite frightening. But it’s also exciting. We’re anxious to start a new journey, and we hope you’ll consider coming along with us.

It would be a glorious symbiotic relationship!

Like the goofy yet protective clownfish, and the loyal and supportive sea anemone! We won’t let anything eat you, if you let us hide in your weird, stinging, tentacle-tube-type things when the big fish come round to eat us.
When all is said and done, if we make it through the month, you will have a pretty damn funny little film to watch.

You will also have gotten us so much closer than anyone else to finally answering the question we’ve been asked over and over, by so many wonderful people all over the world:

“When are you going to make another movie?”

WHO WE ARE

O. HANNAH FILMS is the three-headed troll responsible for the independent zombie film, The Battery. Made on a micro-budget of six thousand dollars, in fourteen days, with a crew of six; the film went on to play at over fifty festivals, winning more than a dozen jury and audience awards, and was featured on countless best-of horror lists. To date, the movie has been distributed in twenty-plus countries worldwide, and was released on DVD and BluRay in the U.S. by Scream Factory.

Download our press kit at http://www.thebatterymovie.com/texpress.zip
For specific press inquiries, please email Tex@ohannahfilms.com

JEREMY GARDNER is a writer, director, actor, unemployed waiter, and answer to the question: “Who is that fat, bearded guy in that hipster zombie movie?” He co-directed and plays the titular idiot in TEX MONTANA WILL SURVIVE! Outside of his own films, he recently appeared in Justin Benson & Aaron Moorhead’s (Resolution) SPRING, and Joe Begos’ (Almost Human) THE MIND’S EYE, and is hard at work waiting for any other amazing filmmakers to call and offer him work. 


CHRISTIAN STELLA is a director, cinematographer, cookbook author and food photographer by trade. By necessity, force—and on occasion—threat of violence, he is also a colorist, editor, sound designer, mixer, producer, and reticent-but-bound-by-the-bonds-of-friendship roommate of Jeremy Gardner. He is the sole reason both THE BATTERY, and TEX MONTANA, look as though they had a hundred times their actual budgets.

ADAM CRONHEIM is an actor, producer, and real estate agent from New York City. Most notably in THE BATTERY, he somehow imbued the thankless role of Mickey with a relatable humanity before being saddled with an even more thankless role off-screen: Taking charge of the constant barrage of paperwork, releases, insurance, legal mumbo-jumbo and business affairs that most first-time filmmakers never think about while living their dream on set. He recently appeared in the post-apocalyptic vampire film, RED SPRING, set for release in 2016.

Because we already made it. 

The only substantial risk taken in this endeavor is our own. 

By electing to bypass the traditional distribution channels, we may well end up with nothing. 

Which would really, really, really suck.

campaign.story:
Ungrip is a new approach to the problem of holding increasingly bigger and slimmer smartphones, making a large phone feel smaller. Rather than clashing with your phone’s style, this simple and effective solution accents both its look and your personality.
When designing Ungrip, we didn't add tons of features that are seldom used. Instead, we focused on two features that are highly visible and functional— how it would look on your device and how it would help you hold your device. We like it simple. And we think it's effective. We hope you think so, too.  
Ungrip is a simple solution that comprises of two parts: The Bumper and the Strap.
Ungrip is beautiful. It’s designed to look good on any modern day phone, not clash with it.
Ungrip is a joy to use. Because it’s made of fabric and not metal. Your fingers will love you for it!
Ungrip is convenient and flexible. There are over a dozen ways to hold your phone with it.
Ungrip is strong. An average phablet weighs around 0.3 pounds (170 grams), but Ungrip can hold a device of up to 4 pounds (1,800 grams), strong enough for a laptop (but not recommended)!
Ungrip uses 3M's VHB (Very High Bond) tapes. They are industrial strength, easily removable and WON'T leave any residues.
Ungrip can be used on phones with or without casing!
NOTE: Ungrip adheres to most flat, non-porous surfaces. It will not stick to rubber, soft-touch silicone, TPU, fabric, and those with waterproof coating.
Ungrip is unintrusive. It’s thin, small and light, and can stay flat when needed.
Ungrip is easy to use. With a snap-on feature, changing the Strap is easier than changing your clothes!
Ungrip's got you covered if you're color-crazy. With tons of different colors (and more to come in the future), you'll go color blind!
Ungrip is designed for everyone. With a lot of pattern designs (and more to come), there’s no excuse to not like one!
Big is now small. You can now buy that large phone which you always wanted but couldn’t use! Because it makes large phones feel a lot smaller.
Effortlessly secured. Your phone would immediately feel secure in your hand, even if you’re not gripping it at all!
Slippery no longer. Those beautiful aluminum bodies are as pretty as they are slippery. But not anymore! Say goodbye to accidental slippage and drops. You won’t miss them.
B*tch-slapped by a phone. Tell the truth... this has happened to you before. It’s embarrasing and it hurts. Ungrip will protect you from your phone!
Just like the good ol’ days. You can now use your phone with one hand again... oh, joy!
 Having Ungrip on your phone allows you to use your phone with one-handed ease.
PLAY

 There are many ways to hold your phone when using Ungrip. Check out some of them here...
PLAY

Mobile Reviews Eh! Check out their site here! Thanks, Aaron! :D
-------------------
We're lucky to get another awesome review from the Murphy Report. It's just an article this time... but just as awesome! :)
Attaching Ungrip
PLAY

Detaching Ungrip
PLAY

 Detaching the Strap
PLAY

For those who love changing their cases or phones frequently, extra adhesives are a must to ensure continued enjoyment of Ungrip. Since Kickstarter doesn't allow more than one pledge, you may add $5 to your chosen pledge to enjoy an Add On pack.
For example: If you're getting a 'Singles - Patterns Collection Pledge' ($16), just add $5 so your total pledge would now be $21. We would then include an Add On to your order. If you want two Add Ons, just add $10 to your pledge... and so on.
Hello! My name is Johann and I’m the designer of Ungrip. Ungrip started a few weeks after I got a new phone. I always used my phone with one hand because I’m lazy, and getting that brand-spanking new large phone was exciting... for the first few weeks. I soon found myself struggling to hold it comfortably, and to hold and use it at the same time! It came to a point that I was about to buy a smaller phone, but I realized I couldn’t live with a small screen again.
So being like MacGyver, I took a lanyard strap and stitched it together, then glued it to the back of my case. It looked stupid, but I didn’t care — I was that frustrated with my phone.
Alpha 1.0.
One day, after using it for about 2 weeks, I realized I wasn’t complaining about how big my phone was anymore. In fact, I didn’t even notice that I had a big phone! That’s when I knew it actually worked! I then thought of developing and marketing this helpful trick. I proceeded to do research on similar solutions in the market, and was surprised to learn that there were many of them available. I liked a solution or two, but in general, none of them really appealed to me. That’s when I decided to develop Ungrip as a better and simpler solution.
Product Development Evolution.
Tooling for Ungrip.
It’s been more than a year of hard work, but all of it was worth it! I’ve been using Ungrip since Alpha 1.0 and couldn’t be happier. I hope you’ll find our team's work helpful in enjoying your phone more. :)

AiryVest is water-resistant and filled with synthetic insulation sandwiched inside of ultra-light nylon fabric that is DWR-treated to shed light moisture.
Synthetic insulation is designed to replicate the qualities of down, but retain them even when wet. It’s made with polyester fibers that are arranged in different sized filaments and intertwined, mimicking down’s lofty clusters. These ultrafine fibers trap warmth in air pockets, providing truly great warmth. Synthetic insulation also tends to be hypoallergenic.
Lycra trimmings around legholes prevent from draughts and warm air escape from inside the vest. Standing collar and longer back provide better protection.
AiryVest is multi-seasonal. Excellent for cold springs, chilly autumns and mild winters.
This dog vest is designed for athletic dogs that are going to be running, jumping and adventuring in inclement weather. Therefore, it is a more fitted apparel, allowing your pup to move freely.
It does not cover the entire length of most dogs and is designed to keep a dog warm and dry.
AiryVest сonstruction allows to easily access your pup's collar to attach a leash.

B (Chest / Girth). Measure the widest part of your dog’s chest, normally behind the front legs. Make sure to give a little slack. A good rule of thumb is to allow 2 fingers to fit inside of the measuring tape.

Design
Mini Hand is designed to be extremely versatile, yet affordable. The first time you hold it, you'll feel the quality of the materials. The base is precisely machined from a billet of aluminum, then anodized for a beautiful finish. 
To ensure a satisfying user experience, the arms and clips are carefully assembled to achieve the proper balance between smoothness and holding power.
Each arm is drilled out by hand and fitted with components. Thread locker is used to ensure the clip remains attached throughout the life of its use. The clips are also covered with heat shrink to prevent marring of the work surface.
The Mini Hand base includes suction tape. This tape will adhere Mini Hand to any non-porous surface and can be removed without leaving behind any sticky residue.
Suction tape is long lasting and can be easily cleaned using a low strength tape. It can be used on a variety of smooth non-porous surfaces such as tabletops, metal, plastic, glass and counter tops.
Using the suction tape is easy. Simply press Mini Hand firmly to the work surface and that's it. Removing it requires lifting at a corner,
 Uses
The various mounting options allow Mini Hand to be used anywhere. Whether its mounted with suction tape, clamped to a table, or screwed to a workbench or wall, Mini Hand can handle it. 
C-clamps or bar clamps are convenient ways to secure Mini Hand to your work station or on the go.
The countersunk screw holes designed into the base allows Mini Hand to be firmly attached to any surface. This provides a more permanent secure mount.
Special Add-Ons
Mini Hand is meant to be versatile. We sell a variety of arms that enable you to customize your Mini Hand for your needs. Additional arms include a universal clamp, fume extractor, swivel and varying lengths. Arms are easy to swap or add, and require only an adjustable wrench.
 The universal clamp can hold a variety of items and can be reused again and again.
Goal
Our goal of $20,000 will allow us to produce the quantity we need to keep the price of the Mini Hand affordable.
Stretch Goals

Stretch Goal 50K - $50,000 - Swivel Clip Upgrade!
Stretch Goal 75K - $75,000 - More colors Upgrade!

Use your phone comfortably while charging preserving the cable shape and core.
Charge Original 90 features an angled casing designed to take the stress out from when you unplug your cable or twist it. The angled connector positions the cable in such a way that allows it for easy access to your device in both portrait and landscape mode, protecting the core of your cable and also offering a comfortable experience to use your device while it is juicing up.
Its angled tip protects the plug and alleviates strain on your cable.
Your life and work can not wait until your phone completes a full charge. It is completely fine if you can't stay away from your phone and need to use it while it is charging beside your bed, office, living room or any charging station you create. If you lean your phone against a pillow when you are in bed or if you seat on a armchair or sofa and you position the phone against your body, in most of the cases with time you might experience your straight casing cable needing a bit of twist or plug and unplug it several times until it starts charging. campaign.story:
INTRODUCING MACNETS
Technology may not be the first thing that comes to mind when you think about products that define a part of your past. When you ask your dad, he can propably tell you all about grandpas first car; the 2 cylinders, the little bit of horsepower, and he’ll tell you all about how he and his siblings were on the back seat with grandma and grandpa in the front, while driving hours straight to a camp side a couple of hundred miles away. Trips like that took a day and would take us 2.5 hours max in current times. But the feels were amazing.
We believe the same memories and feelings are hidden in the technologies that we grew up with. Some products in your life were more than just products, they were the tools of beautiful memories and they became memories themselves. The first personal computer, the first game console, the first mobile phone to holding that gun for Duck Hunt and standing closer and closer to the screen to cheat a bit ☺. You played with your brothers, sisters, friends and sometimes even your parents could be tricked into playing along.
Small things big memories!
Just as the many miniature cars that were produced, we want to produce Macnets, to keep reminding us just how amazing our childhood was, how amazing past technologies were and how simply beautiful those products were designed. We want to produce those past devices as miniatures packed with a strong magnet inside, so they can be placed on the fridge door, but also on a desk or on a bookshelf, everywhere you need a smile from a great memory!
So cool on your fridge!
Ok, who's television is this?!
OUR GOAL
To produce every device ever produced and make them as high quality and beautiful as possible! We are starting with the first 5, but we want the whole history of computing, gaming and communication in our collection. Even that old printer that made that weird high pitch trembling sound, and you had to tear off the paper when done:), yessir, even that one!
HOW IT WORKS
For the lucky receiver, this is how it works: receive Macnet box – let the expectations boil up - open the box and see your Macnet – let your memories be magnetized! – Place Macnet on the fridge or on your desk – and then; bliss/excitement/”I can’t believe how awesome and cute this is”/etc.
And your gift will be awesome! Finding the perfect mold for the Macnets was quite the challenge. Quality wise the Macnets of course need to be perfect, the magnet in the back must be strong and invisible, and the Macnet should also be able to stand on its own, without the weight flipping it over. Also, every Macnet will be hand painted to create the best appearance. And all that presented in an awesome gift box…. Just don’t go down on one knee before you hand it over! ☺
Packed like a king!
Just hanging around a stone cactus!
MACNETS ... with a C?!
Yeah well, in the beginning we produced the Mac and we joked around that the magnet was now called: Macnet. Then friends and family started requesting a game console, a pc, a joystick etc, but the name stuck, so, after nights of in-depth meetings we decided; Macnets it is!
At ease soldier!
The whole team on a shelf!
 GALLERY
It feels so good in the hand :)
Ok, here's what we gonna do...
Don't they look awesome!
Hmm, who didn't show up?!
There's that television again!
SPECIFICATIONS
Macnet Dimensions: max length of every Macnet is 5cm (<2 inches), rest is in proportion.
Basic Weight: 75 grams (box included), that won't tip over your fridge :)
Box Dimensions: 6 cm x 6 cm x 6 cm (6 cm is 2.36 inch)
Material: ABS plastic and Rare Earth magnet
Green choice: All material used is fully recyclable!
Rare Earth magnet guarantees a strong grip!
PROTOTYPING
Although we knew the appearance of our tech, choosing the right materials was quite the challenge. It needs to have a good weight, so it feels like its quality, but it must be light enough to stick to the fridge. The magnet inside must work always and stick very hard to the wanted surface. The outer details are hand painted on with wash proof paint. Trying all types and sorts, we finally found our perfect molds, paints, plastics and cartons and tadaaa; Macnets are here!
ABOUT US
Macnets.co is a little company based in Amsterdam with the goal to magnetize your favorite tech memories into beautiful Macnets. We do it because we believe the technologies we grew up with are such an important part of who we became as an adult. Who we shared the technologies with, were we used them, and how often we used them; they accompany our daily lives. We have a small team, but we give you the biggest thanks for giving us the possibility of creating beautiful Macnets for you.  
FUTURE PRODUCTS
We want all the amazing technologies from are past to be available as a Macnet. If you have any suggestions or amazing ideas for a Macnet, please e-mail us, and we will do everything we can to make it happen!
YOUR SUPPORT
We can’t do this without your help. In order to use the best and safest materials out there, we need your pledges to do so. With them we will create the Macnets that will surprise people all over the world.
Our goal is to reach 15.000 Euro (Approx 17.500 USD), with that we can produce high quality molds and 1000 Macnets which we will sell and use in a lean-and-mean marketing campaign.
We will also start with producing new Macnets, new types of memories! And if you have any idea or dream Macnet; let us know and we will do everything in our power to make it happen.
He's supporting us too... with his presence :)

campaign.story:
East Warren Ave & Barham.
Gratiot and Riopelle is a locally-inspired and focused type foundry inspired by Detroit signage. As I archive found signage around the city, I'll find similarities in the lettering styles and create fonts inspired by the look of individual neighborhoods, then provide them as pay-what-you-can downloads.
I believe that design should be accessible to everybody. 
Currently, there aren't any pay-what-you-can fonts based on Detroit signage, but there are a lot of small businesses looking for affordable design, and even more areas that are losing their unique visual identity. As analog signs are removed, the neighborhood's landscape becomes more uniform as the use of pre-fabricated signs is encouraged.
Compare the sign for Johnny's Real Estate with its neighbor, for example.
By creating a usable font based on the signs in a particular area, and making it available to small businesses in that area, the visual culture lives on even if the sign it's based on is painted over or destroyed.
This project is a winner of the Knight Arts Challenge 2014 in Detroit. Funds donated in support of Gratiot and Riopelle be matched by the John S. and James L. Knight Foundation.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
My main challenge/risk is time. Old signs and handpainted murals are being regularly painted over by the city in a (slightly misguided) effort to reduce blight -- so, if I can't get to these quickly enough, they'll be painted over, sometimes even if the sign is on an open business who paid for the work.

I've been a freelance designer for several years, thanks in part to a supportive local design community. I'm confident I'll continue to get feedback on the fonts in this project from other designers in my shared studio and around the city to keep everything faithful to the source material.

Shipping of everything physical will begin happening sometime after the project is funded and I've made the first few fonts -- I've budgeted for printing costs and have a reliable printer to work with.

Shipping of digital goods, of course, will be a bit faster. :) You'll get them as soon as they're finished, and I'll be sending updates and preview shots regularly.

The Concept
Space Explorer is a pioneering new model for a large-scale public art exhibition, that inspires exploration, by creating moments of wonder and discovery in everyday surroundings. Space Explorer transcends the restrictions of the stuffy, traditional gallery and utilises mobile phone technology to make the experience richer for everyone. The first instalment in the series - titled Another Space & Time will turn Hackney’s untapped outdoor spaces into a thought provoking journey through North America’s desert communities.
Why?
We believe exploration has the power to inspire – bring a sense of wonder - create a sense of freedom- allow us to dream. We want to restore this sense of wonder and adventure to the everyday. It’s all too easy to get lost in the daily routine; by introducing these unexpected moments of wonder into the city, we can change perspective and challenge perception.
What? 
We are producing three main ways of engaging with people. Firstly the exhibition and accompanying app. Our first show; entitled Another Space & Time is an audio & visual show by documentary photographer Robin Mellor (that's me) which searches for the meaning of life within the desert communities of North America. 
Frank - Another Space & Time
Excerpt from an Interview for TMN: 
"Right now the world is going through huge changes: climatically, socially, financially, and spiritually. I think it would benefit us all to consider this question more regularly. We’re bombarded with all sorts of modern superficial distractions and pressures that make us lose sight of what might be important to us.
By asking this question in the desert, you take away these modern distractions. I found people there to be much clearer in their views of the world—unaffected by our modern societal white noise, having had the mental space and time to fully form their views."
The Exhibition
Our first show is launching (with your help!) in Hackney on October 1st, it’s made up of 20 billboard sized images hidden around the streets of Hackney and accompanying soundscape, which is accessed using the Space Explorer App.
The App
The Space Explorer smartphone app uses GPS technology to lead you around the city, Once in the GPS zone of our artwork, the app will immerse you in the bespoke audio soundscape.
The Mag
The free Space Explorer magazine brings you perspective changing stories from pioneering global explorers, as well as showcasing up and coming international photographic talent from the VSCO community.
Talks & Workshops
We plan to host several days of talks and workshops throughout the exhibition period to educate and inspire the local community. Drawn from a broad range of backgrounds and interests, the common thread of inspiration through exploration will weave its way through our programme. 
What's Next?
This is just the start for Space Explorer, we want to spread our empowering spirit of exploration to cities around the world and with your help we can make this a reality.
The Money
We really need your support to help fund Space Explorer, We've got some amazing partners on board who are helping us in numerous ways but we still need this funding to help pay for the printing and installation of the exhibition artwork and to go towards some of the workshops and talks. 
We've come this far with favours and savings and now are asking for your backing to help us bring this project to life. We are not looking to profit from Space Explorer but to use it as a vehicle to share and connect through the positive powers of exploration.
Thanks!!!

THANK YOU backers for believing in this film, and making our dream a reality.
We aren’t wasting any time celebrating-- we're going to get started making this film ASAP because we can’t wait to dig in and tell this story. There is a long hard road ahead, but we are up to the task and thrilled to be on this journey with Bill. Onward!

Please visit our website for updates, scenes and info about the film. Watch a sample scene below.
Bill Nye is on a quest to change the world, and we want you to be part of it!
Once the host of a popular kid’s show, Bill is about to take off his “Science Guy” lab coat and battle the naysayers to create a more scientifically literate and engaged universe.
We’re going to make a film about it. A film for science. A film for the cosmos. The full access, exclusive film about Bill Nye.
We’re documentary filmmakers, but we’re also hardcore Bill Nye fans who spent our middle school years learning about the ecosystem and the color spectrum from his trusty VHS tapes. Bill’s passion and enthusiasm stayed with us, and when we got older, we started making films about science and technology. When we learned that Bill Nye was doing something new, working outside of the classroom to champion science and space exploration and the fight against climate change, we knew we had to make this documentary.
So we did our homework and learned everything we could about Bill. We gathered a great team, including Academy Award-winning producer Seth Gordon, and we created a plan for a documentary that will offer an all access backstage pass to Bill’s epic quest to change the world. Then, we shared our vision with Bill, who not only said yes but opened up his life to us. We’re still a little giddy. It’s awesome!
With Bill on board, we’re ready to start following Bill as he tours the globe, advocates for space policy in Washington DC, launches a satellite, hangs out with Neil deGrasse Tyson, debates climate change deniers, and attempts to fill the big shoes of his former mentor and friend Carl Sagan -- all at a time when science is under attack.
The pieces are all falling in to place, but we need one last boost to make this film happen. We need your support. We need to raise the funds to travel with Bill, buy plane tickets and crash in cheap hotels. We need to find and license the best moments from Bill’s storied career in television -- including “Bill Nye The Science Guy,” as well as the lesser known classics like “Bill’s Basement” and “Almost Live!” Then, we need to hire an amazing team for post-production, including an editor, sound designer, animator, composer and colorist. Finally, we need to send it to film festivals and get it out into the world.
So we are turning to you, people of the internet…. People who grew up on Bill Nye... People who care about science and knowledge and bow ties. If you get on board with this crazy mission, we will make the ultimate documentary about Bill Nye, and science will finally rule (again)!
Carl Sagan once said, “Somewhere, something incredible is waiting to be known.” We know that right here in front of us, there is a great story waiting to be known. If you jump on board and support this film, we promise to give it everything we’ve got. Our hearts, blood, sweat and tears. We will not rest until we’ve made something incredible -- the ultimate film about Bill Nye.
As Bill says, “Let’s change the world!”
Science rules,
Jason & David
Our backers will get exclusive updates from the road, be invited to an awesome party with Bill Nye in New York, and, of course, be part of this dream. And if that’s not enough, we’ve got some pretty sweet rewards.
THE DIRECTORS
 THE PRODUCERS
Join us! Follow us on Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter to spread the word. It makes a HUGE difference to this campaign.

A few years ago we hatched a HUGE idea — to make a documentary film about the Bill Nye behind the Science Guy. We told you, our soon-to-be backers, about this far-out scheme. We shot for the moon, and you got us there!
Last time you heard from us we were still on the film festival circuit, promoting and garnering reviews (which were so hot, they had to be measured in Kelvin). We don't mean to toot our own horn (actually, we do), but we're still holding steady at 100% on the notorious . To those of you who were lucky enough to attend an early showing, "We love you, man!" Please leave us a review on or  so we can keep our scores at a sizzle. For those who have not yet seen what your funding has created, the time has come...

updates.update_userinfo: “Dude, where is my stream of the film?”
updates.update_content:
Greetings Scientists, 
Bill Nye: Science Guy is heading to the silver screen! Last week the Hollywood trades broke the news that PBSd and POV acquired the theatrical and television rights to the documentary. As filmmakers, we always dreamed of having a theatrical release complete with popcorn, trailers playing before the movie, and 5.1 surround sound. It’s increasingly rare that documentaries get the opportunity to play on the big screen, so we’re over the moon that audiences will be able to see our film in theaters. PBSd is PBS’ new theatrical arm helmed by some very talented folks who understand how to get a film out into the world. Bill is so stoked for the theatrical release this fall that he’s personally attending the New York and Los Angeles shows (and possibly some *surprise appearances* in other cities too). Stay tuned for the *official* announcement with dates.

updates.update_userinfo: All Systems Are Go for Theatrical Release
updates.update_content:
Howdy Scientists!
Consider the following: the world premiere at SXSW was a smash hit! There were many many Kickstarter backers in attendance, so thank you to everyone who came out to Austin and saw the film. We literally could not have made the movie without our amazing backers!
The film, so far, is being positively received— the reviews are excellent (Variety, IndieWire, Austin Chronicle, Hollywood Reporter, Movieweb, Roger Ebert, Tracking Board, Ars Technica, , , and ) and the audience reaction has been really effusive and warm. We had to turn away 1000+ people who came to the premiere, which was a bummer, but showed us that the demand for a documentary on Bill Nye is bigly YUGE.

updates.update_userinfo: BILL NYE: SCIENCE GUY Heading to the Big Screen
updates.update_content:
Like many of our friends and colleagues, Jason and I are absolutely horrified by the sweeping electoral college results of the election. Donald Trump has used the worst side of humanity to wrench his way into the highest office in the most influential country in the world. Although nobody truly knows his policy yet, he's used misogyny, racism, and rapid-fire lies to appeal to the most misinformed voters to elect him to power. The world, and we, are stunned.
While the depression and shock still resonates here in the edit room, we are trying to understand what we can do to start the pushback against the social forces that allowed this man to become president. Jason and I firmly believe that the film is more important than it ever has been before. The entire premise of this project is that the forces of anti-science have slowly risen to power, and it will take a scientifically literate electorate to make the best decisions for the planet today and in the future. We hope that the film will maintain the entertaining and exciting feeling that we all experienced while shooting, but also it will leave the viewers knowing the devastation caused by a society that doesn't understand science or care about the environment. This has always been Bill's goals, and so we couldn't be more thankful for his work and for him allowing us to share this story.

Hi, we are Alex and Hamish, and we love the New York City Subway. We also really like posters. So, we combined the two!
Last year, Hamish drew all 468 subway station signs and arranged them in alphabetical order. We printed them on a poster to hang in our apartment.
Why? Because...subway! 
Everyone who visits our apartment loves the poster and asks where they can get one. That's why we have decided to share it exclusively on Kickstarter. 
But the poster we are offering here is much cooler. We have enlisted the same Italian printers we worked with for The Standards Manual, who will print the poster in 11 Pantone® spot colors! 
1 poster, 3 sizes
THE POSTER
Size of the poster in the video and photos on this page
24" x 33 ¼" 
610mm x 845mm 
11 Pantone spot colors 
Printed in Italy 
THE EDITION POSTER
Limited edition of the 468 hand numbered posters
28" x 38 ¾" 
711mm x 984mm
11 Pantone spot colors

THE SCREENPRINT POSTER                                                                                            Limited edition of 100 hand numbered posters
40" x 55.5"
1016 x 1410mm
12 color screenprint
Made in New York City by Alexander Heinrici 
All are officially licensed by the MTA and
only available on Kickstarter.
The Screenprint poster
The screenprint poster uses the original white and black color scheme for the signs, originally devised by Bob Noorda and Massimo Vignelli for the NYCTA in 1970 (Standards Manual fans: you know what we mean!).
We are proud to announce that we have enlisted master printer Alexander Heinrici (who printed for Andy Warhol) to produce a limited run of 100 pieces.
Each will be a beautiful 12-color hand-pulled screenprint on light grey fine art paper––signed and numbered.
These are pricey to print, but oh man will they be stunning. And HUGE: 40" x 55.5" (1016 x 1410mm)
Below are some mockups of the design.
The Screenprint poster
The Screenprint poster
The Screenprint poster uses Standard Medium rather than Helvetica Neue Bold
The Screenprint poster uses Standard Medium rather than Helvetica Neue Bold
Why did we make this poster?
We didn't only decide to produce this poster because our friends wanted it. During the The Standards Manual campaign our fascination with the subway signage only deepened. Even though the signs have changed from the original 1970 Unimark designs, they remain close to the original intent of Bob Noorda and Massimo Vignelli. 
Their staying power is a testament to the simplicity and elegance of the design. This is an iconic design that should be remembered and celebrated, and we think a beautifully printed poster is a great way to get it into many people's hands.
The page from The Standards Manual that inspired the poster.
Printing specifications
We plan to print the posters with one of Italy's finest printers.
We worked with these printers to produce The Standards Manual book, so we are fully confident they will nail this too. 
Each poster will make 2 passes through a 6 color press, receiving 6 colors in the first pass, and 5 in the second. Black will be applied last, to avoid smudging as it passes through the press. 
A stochastic screen will be used on the plates, to ensure we have perfect registration.
We are still deciding on the paper, but will be using only the highest quality matt or silk coated paper we can source from Europe. We love paper and will keep you updated! 
Shipping specifications
Each poster will be shipped in a 4" (102mm) diameter cardboard tube, and will be individually rolled in a glassine interleaving sheet. 

Every shipment will be trackable on our end.
––
We hope you love this poster as much as we do. Thanks to all of you for your support!
And a special thanks to those who gave us their time and thoughts:

Happy riding,
Alex and Hamish

campaign.story:
Freedom.
Prison.
Under normal circumstances, they are polar opposites.  In fact, prison is actually defined as “a place in which people are physically confined and, usually, deprived of a range of personal freedoms.”  Basically, if you have one, you don’t have the other. Simple enough, right?
As it turns out, it’s not always that simple.  No matter what you currently believe about our correctional system, I would like to invite you to read the words of someone who has been there, done that.
Relatively speaking, I was not locked up for an unbearable amount of time: May 21, 2007 to August 31, 2010.  In prison, some might call that short-timing.  For me though, those days were more than just squares on a calendar.  I missed four Father’s Days.  I missed four birthdays.  I missed four baseball seasons.
Then again, I’m not big on holidays, and as it turned out, I did get out just in time to see a few baseball games, and I was fortunate enough to be about 20 rows behind home plate at the Ballpark in Arlington when the Rangers defeated the Yankees to win the 2010 American League Championship Series.
So what did I really miss while I was locked up?  Well, for starters, I was not at the hospital to welcome my niece into the world.  And I was not at the funeral home to say goodbye to my uncle who passed away just a few weeks before I got out.
I was not there when my son took his first steps.  I had no part in teaching him how to talk.  I still don’t know what his first word was, but I know for certain it wasn't Daddy.
For that span of nearly 1200 days, I was not a part of my own family.  Sure, they tried to include me – and that helped – but nothing can take the place of actually being there, and nothing will ever undo the pain of being absent for so many good memories that my family made without me.
So what is freedom? And what is prison? As it turns out, it’s not necessarily true to say that they can’t coexist. Contradicting as it might seem, the first time I ever experienced freedom was in prison.
And I want to tell you all about it in my book, The Blue Chip Store.
